subject: Remove child members activation for OVS-DPDK bond
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-25 10:09:36.000000000', 'files': ['os_net_config/impl_ifcfg.py'], 'message': 'Remove child members activation for OVS-DPDK bond

While creating DPDK bond, if-up of the bond interface
itself will activate the member interfaces. Individual
members should not be called for ifup.

Additionally, removing the option to select the primary
active-slave member for the bond, because of #1654975.
Once it is fixed, primary selection from the network
config will be added.

Change-Id: I83527ada4a3618927d55b7aa06d436686b12d5b8
Closes-Bug: #1643026.
(cherry picked from commit f40b61ed6712f80a76a39cddfb11d02d20d06e2d)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove child members activation for OVS-DPDK bond

While creating DPDK bond, if-up of the bond interface
itself will activate the member interfaces. Individual
members should not be called for ifup.

Additionally, removing the option to select the primary
active-slave member for the bond, because of #1654975.
Once it is fixed, primary selection from the network
config will be added.

Change-Id: I83527ada4a3618927d55b7aa06d436686b12d5b8
Closes-Bug: #1643026.
(cherry picked from commit f40b61ed6712f80a76a39cddfb11d02d20d06e2d)

commit_message:
Postpone deprecation warnings to Pike

2.12.0 added a DeprecationWarning a bit late in
Ocata for other projects to react properly. For example
Neutron logs get filled up pretty badly. So let's
defer the deprecation warnings for one more release

Note f25543fcc792ebf155728a91fde06e8dc4e96cea adds
the warning(s).

Instead of a full revert, let's just key off of a
variable _log_deprecation_warnings both in context.py
and test_context.py with a FIXME reminder

Closes-Bug: #1660088

Change-Id: I45ba9a0ed628f3347c7c3b346e907e4363452dd8
(cherry picked from commit 96432cbe4d3ed7c6ea80c70786f8b406a488f5db)

commit_message:
Use same variable for --[no-]maintenance

This changes the code to use the same parsed_args.maintenance
variable to keep track of whether --maintenance or --no-maintenance
arguments were specified in the 'openstack baremetal node list'
command.

This is a follow up to 4487a372022aca326066f3c3b59f08ce903b1af3.

Change-Id: I4058b34881ff36f9e0b0d93bf0ed252c5e3f94ee

subject: Set INTROSPECT_NODES before calling register-nodes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-27 19:43:50.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/deploy.sh'], 'message': "Set INTROSPECT_NODES before calling register-nodes

The register-nodes in tripleo.sh is expecting INTROSPECT_NODES to be
set in order to actually introspect the nodes. This sets it, then unsets
after the --register-nodes call so that it doesn't leak anywhere.

Change-Id: I6f39a19f51ad94c9ad541856083991d98ee63a52
Closes-Bug: #1659931
"}]
commit_message:
Set INTROSPECT_NODES before calling register-nodes

The register-nodes in tripleo.sh is expecting INTROSPECT_NODES to be
set in order to actually introspect the nodes. This sets it, then unsets
after the --register-nodes call so that it doesn't leak anywhere.

Change-Id: I6f39a19f51ad94c9ad541856083991d98ee63a52
Closes-Bug: #1659931

subject: Deprecate introspection_delay_drivers option and make it no-op
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-26 12:58:58.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_inspector/test/unit/test_introspect.py', 'releasenotes/notes/introspection-delay-drivers-deprecation-1d0c25b112fbd4da.yaml', 'ironic_inspector/conf.py', 'example.conf'], 'message': "Deprecate introspection_delay_drivers option and make it no-op

With switch to virtualbmc we can no longer distinguish between virtual
and bare metal nodes. To stay on a safer side, introspection_delay now
affects all drivers.

I'm also aware of similar DHCP problems on bare metal.

Also renamed unit tests for clarity.

Change-Id: I7d69cd899ec4d893b21cc49d59834dd3c83e0fe2
"}]
commit_message:
Deprecate introspection_delay_drivers option and make it no-op

With switch to virtualbmc we can no longer distinguish between virtual
and bare metal nodes. To stay on a safer side, introspection_delay now
affects all drivers.

I'm also aware of similar DHCP problems on bare metal.

Also renamed unit tests for clarity.

Change-Id: I7d69cd899ec4d893b21cc49d59834dd3c83e0fe2

subject: Swift account quota support
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-09-08 15:31:17.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/access_and_security/floating_ips/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/api/swift.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/identity/projects/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/defaults/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/test/integration_tests/regions/menus.py', 'openstack_dashboard/test/tests/quotas.py', 'releasenotes/notes/add-swift-quotas-4224442b97cf42dd.yaml', 'openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.py.example', 'openstack_dashboard/usage/quotas.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/identity/projects/workflows.py', 'openstack_dashboard/test/test_data/swift_data.py'], 'message': "Swift account quota support

Add support for swift account quotas on a per-tenant basis. Swift
doesn't expose quota defaults, so that functionality is stubbed out.

In order to retrieve or set quotas for swift, the user/project needs
the ResellerAdmin role set on Swift. Since this commonly isn't the
case (for instance, in the devstack test harness), if the role
(ResellerAdmin by default, but custommizable as SWIFT_ADMIN_ROLE)
is not assigned the quota fields are disabled in the UI (removing them
entirely from the form creates a strange user experience).

Currently the only account quota field supported is bytes until
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/312603/ lands.

Closes-Bug: #1604572
Change-Id: Ie4172299b8eccc24575c9865993fa8fda431f35d
"}]
commit_message:
Swift account quota support

Add support for swift account quotas on a per-tenant basis. Swift
doesn't expose quota defaults, so that functionality is stubbed out.

In order to retrieve or set quotas for swift, the user/project needs
the ResellerAdmin role set on Swift. Since this commonly isn't the
case (for instance, in the devstack test harness), if the role
(ResellerAdmin by default, but custommizable as SWIFT_ADMIN_ROLE)
is not assigned the quota fields are disabled in the UI (removing them
entirely from the form creates a strange user experience).

Currently the only account quota field supported is bytes until
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/312603/ lands.

Closes-Bug: #1604572
Change-Id: Ie4172299b8eccc24575c9865993fa8fda431f35d

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7160, 'name': 'arkady kanevsky', 'email': 'akanevsk@redhat.com', 'username': 'arkady'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 10250, 'name': 'Christopher Dearborn', 'email': 'Christopher.Dearborn@dell.com', 'username': 'cdearbor'}, {'_account_id': 10379, 'name': 'Rajini Karthik', 'email': 'rrajini@gmail.com', 'username': 'rajinir'}, {'_account_id': 18893, 'name': 'Miles Gould', 'email': 'mgould@redhat.com', 'username': 'pozorvlak'}, {'_account_id': 23847, 'name': 'Richard G. Pioso', 'email': 'richard.pioso@dell.com', 'username': 'richard.pioso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-25 16:28:48.000000000', 'files': ['dracclient/tests/wsman_mocks/wsman-enum_context-1.xml', 'dracclient/tests/wsman_mocks/wsman-enum_context-2.xml', 'dracclient/wsman.py', 'dracclient/tests/test_wsman.py', 'dracclient/tests/wsman_mocks/wsman-enum_context-4.xml', 'dracclient/tests/wsman_mocks/wsman-enum_context-3.xml'], 'message': 'WSMAN enumerate fails to return all entries

When querying an enumeration using the WSMAN enumerate method, not all
entries are returned if there are more than max_elems (default of 100)
in the enumeration.

When querying an enumeration, the first response returns <wsman:Items>
in the body.  Successive pulls, however, contain <wsen:Items>.

The old code always queried for <wsen:Items>, which caused the first
batch of attributes to be dropped only when the number of entries in
the enumeration exceeded max_elems.

This patch queries for <wsman:Items> in the first response, and for
<wsen:Items> in successive responses.

Change-Id: I2e9036b562c7d7ba5af188dd552b6c67388bb02c
Closes-Bug: #1659052
'}]
commit_message:
WSMAN enumerate fails to return all entries

When querying an enumeration using the WSMAN enumerate method, not all
entries are returned if there are more than max_elems (default of 100)
in the enumeration.

When querying an enumeration, the first response returns <wsman:Items>
in the body.  Successive pulls, however, contain <wsen:Items>.

The old code always queried for <wsen:Items>, which caused the first
batch of attributes to be dropped only when the number of entries in
the enumeration exceeded max_elems.

This patch queries for <wsman:Items> in the first response, and for
<wsen:Items> in successive responses.

Change-Id: I2e9036b562c7d7ba5af188dd552b6c67388bb02c
Closes-Bug: #1659052

commit_message:
Fix double call to "qemu-img create"

Introduced by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/147186,
and unit tests didn't notice (integrated gate testing too)
We noticed this in Virtuozzo Storage CI, as it requires
backing_fmt to be defined when snapshot is created,
because otherwise it accesses backing file, which could
be held by Qemu and not available (our storage doesn't
allow simultaneous open from different mountpoints)

Change-Id: I9adcc57ffc79548872e7a5c5b0935a2cb4a2dea7

subject: Replace yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-23 05:53:27.000000000', 'files': ['translator/shell.py', 'translator/hot/tosca/tosca_policies_scaling.py', 'translator/common/utils.py'], 'message': 'Replace yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Avoid dangerous file parsing and object serialization libraries.
yaml.load is the obvious function to use but it is dangerous[1]
Because yaml.load return Python object may be dangerous if you
receive a YAML document from an untrusted source such as the
Internet. The function yaml.safe_load limits this ability to
simple Python objects like integers or lists.

In addition, Bandit flags yaml.load() as security risk so replace
all occurrences with yaml.safe_load(). Thus I replace yaml.load()
with yaml.safe_load()

[1]https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: Ifaecff145e91f72911ae05ea274a4977c56212c7
Closes-Bug: #1634265
'}]
commit_message:
Replace yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Avoid dangerous file parsing and object serialization libraries.
yaml.load is the obvious function to use but it is dangerous[1]
Because yaml.load return Python object may be dangerous if you
receive a YAML document from an untrusted source such as the
Internet. The function yaml.safe_load limits this ability to
simple Python objects like integers or lists.

In addition, Bandit flags yaml.load() as security risk so replace
all occurrences with yaml.safe_load(). Thus I replace yaml.load()
with yaml.safe_load()

[1]https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: Ifaecff145e91f72911ae05ea274a4977c56212c7
Closes-Bug: #1634265

commit_message:
Use UUID instead of "00000" for UniqueId

The swarm bay should pass specified "UniqueId" to the resource of
OS::Heat::WaitConditionHandle, but the "UniqueId" is "00000" in
the templates of swarm. So let's use UUID instead of "00000".
In addition, "UniqueID" seems to be obsolete, Use "Id" instead.

Change-Id: I86739db4a2e6faf93d55fe4998bada110de118c6
Closes-Bug: #1606486

commit_message:
[Devstack] Set DEFAULT_IMAGE_NAME variable

The logic of setting DEFAULT_IMAGE_NAME was moved to ironic
devstack plugin but original variable DEFAULT_IMAGE_NAME is
not set, while it is used by grenade.
This patch fixes setting DEFAULT_IMAGE_NAME in ironic devstack
plugin.

Change-Id: I245ca8acba14b550efe355e8a3afc8c81cdc4a23

commit_message:
Switch to decorators.idempotent_id

test.idempotent_id is being kept temporary to migrate
to new lib interface. Now idempotent_id is available as Tempest stable
interface decorators and all plugins tests using the old decorator
should be switched to new interface.

In future, Once all plugins are switched to new decorator Tempest
will remove the test.idempotent_id

Change-Id: I20ef363a008b1c01652015cc2ada69777b8859d9
Related-Bug: 1616913

commit_message:
Enable domain specific drivers

Enable support for domain specific drivers, managed via
configuration files (instead of directly using the API and
database).

Using multiple domains means that calls to users.list must
be scoped to a specific domain; ensure that v3 calls to this
method are appropriately scoped.

Change-Id: I7ed84b7210597ab1633eba343a0c68741a5a8578
Partial-Bug: 1645803

revisions:
[{'number': 21, 'created': '2017-01-27 14:44:58.000000000', 'files': ['templates/plugins/ml2/sriov_nic_agent.ini.j2', 'templates/plugins/ml2/linuxbridge_agent.ini.j2', 'templates/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini.j2', 'releasenotes/notes/neutron-sriov-50c0099554574d01.yaml', 'tasks/neutron_post_install.yml', 'doc/source/configure-network-services.rst', 'tasks/neutron_init.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Implementation Neutron SR-IOV

Change-Id: I7b580db0496ff009a2f64c71447b2977f22d6bf6

Implements: sriov support

commit_message:
Implementation Neutron SR-IOV

This change implements SR-IOV support inside Neutron via
the new ``ml2.sriov`` plugin.
The current implementation automatically configures the ML2
mechanism drivers via the enabled neutron_plugins and
configured mechanisms attribute inside the dictionary.
The implementation is based off the neutron-sriov-nic-agent
and configures physical device mappings over a new
attribute ``sriov_host_interface`` as part of the
provider_networks configuration.
Additionally the FDB agent inside the ``linuxbridge_agent.ini``
is enabled to support the linuxbridge and sriov-nic-agent on the
same interface.

Closes-Bug: #1653283

Co-Authored-By: James Denton <james.denton@rackspace.com>

Change-Id: I7b580db0496ff009a2f64c71447b2977f22d6bf6
Depends-On: Ia62725e2369f75000157e0ab2c3f858e61fef10d
Implements: sriov support

revisions:

This patch changes grouping key to K8s object's 'selfLink' to help

'selfLink' is as unique as UID as far as Kuryr is concerned.

Partially-Implements: blueprint kuryr-k8s-integration

commit_message:
Improve pipeline/Async logging

Currently events are grouped by K8s object's UID and that grouping
key is used for logging in Async handler.

This patch changes grouping key to K8s object's 'selfLink' to help
with log readability. It has no impact on functionality since
'selfLink' is as unique as UID as far as Kuryr is concerned.

Change-Id: Ie903f64d181723d5db0f59dcdf282f5a206879a3
Partially-Implements: blueprint kuryr-k8s-integration

subject: Track failures during sorting of test results
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-10 18:27:53.000000000', 'files': ['os_testr/subunit2html.py', 'os_testr/tests/test_subunit2html.py'], 'message': "Track failures during sorting of test results

The current logic only considers the first occurrence of a test class
and doesn't update a class's pass/fail status after that. So a test
class, for example:

 TestClass
   test_1 pass
   test_2 fail
   test_3 pass

is counted as a passing test class even though it has a failure.

This adds failure tracking to the test result sorting so that any
failure in a test class will make it considered a failing test class
and be sorted at the top of the HTML result page.

Closes-Bug: #1640889

Change-Id: I06919336a09c4afda8ec3a9e7d64d305fbd169c3
"}]
commit_message:
Track failures during sorting of test results

The current logic only considers the first occurrence of a test class
and doesn't update a class's pass/fail status after that. So a test
class, for example:

 TestClass
   test_1 pass
   test_2 fail
   test_3 pass

is counted as a passing test class even though it has a failure.

This adds failure tracking to the test result sorting so that any
failure in a test class will make it considered a failing test class
and be sorted at the top of the HTML result page.

Closes-Bug: #1640889

Change-Id: I06919336a09c4afda8ec3a9e7d64d305fbd169c3

commit_message:
Fix typo and change regexp to regex

This commit fixes some typos and changes 'regexp' to 'regex'. I think
'regexp' is also correct. However, in ostestr, they are mixed. So users
may be confused with it. So let's fix it.

Change-Id: I6c9042527707315f5dbb56f4a406327668c57d04

commit_message:
Allow diskless nodes introspection

There is a demand to use introspection on diskless nodes to figure out
what is possible to figure out.

We might need more changes to properly support diskless nodes, this
change is just to allow people to play with it.

The property ``local_gb == 0`` for a diskless node.

Change-Id: I21b2f2c069fdbf767367ec3d1fbf77bab6292b25
Partial-Bug: #1554243

Closes-Bug: #1660214

commit_message:
Correct ringbuilder's set_weight usage string

The large version of the set_weight usage is missing the
new weight value. This has lead to confusion on the mailing
list.

This patch adds a <new_weight> option to not only add the
missing argument but also to make the command more clear
by differentiate between the search weight (--weight) and
how to set the new.

Change-Id: I7a4c5a6a4438f647fa33d65e22d1863c27d345be
Closes-Bug: #1660214

commit_message:
v1 execution plan template processing was fixed

In v1 execution plans Scripts section must contain a list
of base64-encoded files. But instead of a file content,
the file path was encoded.

Closes-Bug: #1657839

subject: Fix data display when listing resources
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-26 20:49:11.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchiclient/v1/resource_cli.py'], 'message': "Fix data display when listing resources

The list of columns is currently hardcoded and does not take into account extra
columns returned when using the `--details` option. This build a dynamic column
list in all cases.

It also hides the (deprecated) fields `created_by_*` if `creator` is present.
It also hides the `metrics` field in most cases (except show) as it's usually
big and make the list very long in some cases.

Change-Id: Id25e9f30189cb7faccf3f4b9adb4df413435296c
"}]
commit_message:
Fix data display when listing resources

The list of columns is currently hardcoded and does not take into account extra
columns returned when using the `--details` option. This build a dynamic column
list in all cases.

It also hides the (deprecated) fields `created_by_*` if `creator` is present.
It also hides the `metrics` field in most cases (except show) as it's usually
big and make the list very long in some cases.

Change-Id: Id25e9f30189cb7faccf3f4b9adb4df413435296c

commit_message:
Switch to decorators.idempotent_id

test.idempotent_id is being kept temporary to migrate
to new lib interface. Now idempotent_id is available as Tempest stable
interface decorators and all plugins tests using the old decorator
should be switched to new interface.

In future, Once all plugins are switched to new decorator Tempest
will remove the test.idempotent_id

Change-Id: I993fcd22070dca995fb2fb59e876230e8fd0df9e
Related-Bug: 1616913

commit_message:
Stop accepting 1 return code for cell_v2_map_cell0

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/420132/ has merged, so Nova now returns
0 and we don't need to accept 1 return code, which was a workaround.

Cleanup this workaround and so the exec will fail Nova sends 1 return
code.

Change-Id: I530ea2631cec7d49f2a4f68f0fec3eae0b45ad88

2.12.0 added a DeprecationWarning a bit late in

Neutron logs get filled up pretty badly. So let's
defer the deprecation warnings for one more release

Note f25543fcc792ebf155728a91fde06e8dc4e96cea adds
the warning(s).

Instead of a full revert, let's just key off of a

Change-Id: I45ba9a0ed628f3347c7c3b346e907e4363452dd8
"}]
commit_message:
Postpone deprecation warnings to Pike

2.12.0 added a DeprecationWarning a bit late in
Ocata for other projects to react properly. For example
Neutron logs get filled up pretty badly. So let's
defer the deprecation warnings for one more release

Note f25543fcc792ebf155728a91fde06e8dc4e96cea adds
the warning(s).

Instead of a full revert, let's just key off of a
variable _log_deprecation_warnings both in context.py
and test_context.py with a FIXME reminder

Closes-Bug: #1660088

Change-Id: I45ba9a0ed628f3347c7c3b346e907e4363452dd8

commit_message:
Support to provide 'image_driver' during container create

This patch adds the functionality to support image_driver
during container create/run. If user provides a valid image_driver,
that is defined in configuration he/she will be allowed to create
the container otherwise the request will fail. This patch also
add image_driver field in db, so that user can inspect which image
driver he/she used during the container create.

Partially-Implements: BP allow-specify-image-driver
Change-Id: Id2299a613ed414b2df67c103fe6cda0397ab791d

subject: Changes image creation/deletion in sanity_check to be atomic..
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-25 18:06:46.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/tests/functional/sanity_check.py', 'muranodashboard/tests/functional/base.py'], 'message': 'Changes image creation/deletion in sanity_check to be atomic..

Right now, image creation/deletion is done at the class level in
ImageTestCase. Also, in TestSuiteImage relies on self.repair_image
to clean up the class-level image through the UI. This has
several potential points of failure:

 - self.repair_image is not called via self.addCleanup:
   if the test fails before repair_image is called, the image
   is not restored.
 - self.repair_image is done via UI: this can obviously fail,
   because Selenium should never be used to reliably clean up
   a resource.
 - self.image.id is used in many different classes that inherit
   from ImageTestCase: this can result in failures in other
   test suites.

This patch changes self.image to be test-level, created in
setUp instead of setUpClass and deleted in tearDown instead
of tearDownClass.

This is an example of a log that shows multiple tests failing
across different test suites because the class-level image
(probably) was already deleted and thus not found:

https://murano-ci.mirantis.com/logs/25/424525/1/check/gate-murano-dashboard-ubuntu/ca45725/

Change-Id: I0c8628c7fdf182cc512c16faa30f1dd763b8f08e
'}]
commit_message:
Changes image creation/deletion in sanity_check to be atomic..

Right now, image creation/deletion is done at the class level in
ImageTestCase. Also, in TestSuiteImage relies on self.repair_image
to clean up the class-level image through the UI. This has
several potential points of failure:

 - self.repair_image is not called via self.addCleanup:
   if the test fails before repair_image is called, the image
   is not restored.
 - self.repair_image is done via UI: this can obviously fail,
   because Selenium should never be used to reliably clean up
   a resource.
 - self.image.id is used in many different classes that inherit
   from ImageTestCase: this can result in failures in other
   test suites.

This patch changes self.image to be test-level, created in
setUp instead of setUpClass and deleted in tearDown instead
of tearDownClass.

This is an example of a log that shows multiple tests failing
across different test suites because the class-level image
(probably) was already deleted and thus not found:

https://murano-ci.mirantis.com/logs/25/424525/1/check/gate-murano-dashboard-ubuntu/ca45725/

Change-Id: I0c8628c7fdf182cc512c16faa30f1dd763b8f08e

conf: fix N313 hacking check

It was lacking unit test coverage. Fixed.

When try to delete an instance in network topology view, horizon would

commit_message:
Support to delete instance from network topology view

When try to delete an instance in network topology view, horizon would
try to load project/instance table in background, then do the delete
row action to the instance.
But the project instance table was paginated, it only load the first
page instances. The delete action would not work if you try to delete
an instance that are not in the first page.
The patch try to fix the bug.

Change-Id: I317bd1ee418d19c075ae3ac8d39563a0514b1795
Closes-Bug: #1597677

subject: Fix MapRFS test__execute to not impact others
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-25 02:00:34.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/share/drivers/maprfs/test_maprfs.py'], 'message': "Fix MapRFS test__execute to not impact others

MapRFS test__execute_local() can fail trying ssh connect
when it is supposed to only do local tests.
The host list can be modified by other tests. So,
fix the test that modifies hosts. Make it use its own
instance of utils so it won't affect others.

Add a little more validation too.

Change-Id: I42bc2247c94490c9a0aad6c401b0fe44ccd99030
Closes-Bug: #1659162
"}]
commit_message:
Fix MapRFS test__execute to not impact others

MapRFS test__execute_local() can fail trying ssh connect
when it is supposed to only do local tests.
The host list can be modified by other tests. So,
fix the test that modifies hosts. Make it use its own
instance of utils so it won't affect others.

Add a little more validation too.

Change-Id: I42bc2247c94490c9a0aad6c401b0fe44ccd99030
Closes-Bug: #1659162

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-29 08:59:21.000000000', 'files': ['mcagents/erase_node.rb'], 'message': "Erase only boot code in MBR during node delete

Zeroing first 1Mb of a block device will almost always
lead to serios system error, if there is a filesystem
on this block device and this filesystem is mounted.

This code had 2 points: to prevent system from booting
from hard drive after reboot and to prevent anaconda
(or other OS installer) to automatically recognize
disk structure. But since we only use image-based provision
this is not the case anymore.

It's enough to clear first 446 bytes of MBR where the first
stage of a bootloader resides. So we will also be able to
check nodes disks and filesystems after deleting it from
cluster for troubleshooting for example, because partition
scheme will not be touched.

https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/Master_Boot_Record

Change-Id: I60f2b250d6d5997b4b471c27ed00d057ae73c30a
Fixes-bug: #1538587
"}]
commit_message:
Erase only boot code in MBR during node delete

Zeroing first 1Mb of a block device will almost always
lead to serios system error, if there is a filesystem
on this block device and this filesystem is mounted.

This code had 2 points: to prevent system from booting
from hard drive after reboot and to prevent anaconda
(or other OS installer) to automatically recognize
disk structure. But since we only use image-based provision
this is not the case anymore.

It's enough to clear first 446 bytes of MBR where the first
stage of a bootloader resides. So we will also be able to
check nodes disks and filesystems after deleting it from
cluster for troubleshooting for example, because partition
scheme will not be touched.

https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/Master_Boot_Record

Change-Id: I60f2b250d6d5997b4b471c27ed00d057ae73c30a
Fixes-bug: #1538587

[{'number': 17, 'created': '2017-01-26 21:41:45.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_l3.py', 'neutron/db/l3_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_hamode_db.py'], 'message': 'Retry on routerport delete race

After deleting the router interfaces, another concurrent
process (e.g. HA port creation) could happen before the actual
router is deleted, which would lead to an SQLAlchemy error due
to the relationship being violated.

This patch fixes the issue by bumping the router revision before
deleting the router to check for concurrent interface additions.
A race will trigger a staledataerror which will be retried by
the decorator

Closes-Bug: #1655281
Change-Id: I465e9a2f9b216991afa26c16271854fb88068006
'}]
commit_message:
Retry on routerport delete race

After deleting the router interfaces, another concurrent
process (e.g. HA port creation) could happen before the actual
router is deleted, which would lead to an SQLAlchemy error due
to the relationship being violated.

This patch fixes the issue by bumping the router revision before
deleting the router to check for concurrent interface additions.
A race will trigger a staledataerror which will be retried by
the decorator

Closes-Bug: #1655281
Change-Id: I465e9a2f9b216991afa26c16271854fb88068006

commit_message:
Adds support for the ironic-oneview drivers [+Docs].

This change adds support for the oneview drivers (agent, iscsi).

Note that changes on the ironic installation will occur only when
the oneview drivers are being used (agent_pxe_oneview or
iscsi_pxe_oneview are in the ironic_openstack_driver_list). This
means that this patch should not change anything on the the default
ironic installation (using agent_ipmitool driver).

Change-Id: I969df888c6a8b68e7a1a0643b46eee4b546ec13c

commit_message:
drop api and storage references from install-guide

stop telling people how to use deprecated/unmaintained stuff
- remove all db docs detailing mongo install/config
- cleanup get_started.rst
  - remove note about future agents because i don't know what magic
    it's hinting at.
  - add note that collector is optional
- drop all notes about api service and notes about storage
- drop all stuff about configuring api with apache
- replace ceilometer+mongo config notes with ceilometer+gnocchi.
- remove keystone_authtoken config since no more api
- point all distro docs to gnocchi
- add a note to say api+storage is dead.

Change-Id: I494b4e7013ca146ffa640a356cacc4a1a5ee85e8

commit_message:
Hyper-V PCI Passthrough

Discrete Device Assignment is a new feature in Windows Server 2016,
offering users the possibility of taking some of the PCI Express
devices in their systems and pass them through directly to a guest VM.

Co-Authored-By: Claudiu Belu <cbelu@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Depends-On: I8e7782d3e1e9f8e92406604f05504a7754ffa3c2

Implements: blueprint hyper-v-pci-passthrough

Change-Id: Ica395a982da1ffa4ead41601124d192a838ea1ad

commit_message:
Return default for change list

If the task or role is skipped, ansible still tries to evaluate
variables and doesn't consider set_fact, having ansible change
list as undefined, which stops playbook with fatal error.

Change-Id: I7417918b26893fb37bed35260eee7cc98feaea9a

commit_message:
Fix token expire wich may happen in using clients

Add a new way to create clients, which usees session and can solve the
bug that the token may expire during protecting works. Then we can create
client once and use it all the time(<48h) without worry that the token may
expire.

Change-Id: I8becc6db0b3624039eddaa373965b1ba85066606
Implements: blueprint refactor-clients
Partial-Bug: #1566793

commit_message:
Migrate testing to ostestr and adding docs

Following commits not only enables running
unit tests with ostestr, like other
OS projects, but also:
* enables covarage with testr
* enables building documentation with build_sphinx commands

Additionally:
* tox.ini was organized a bit
* (cherry picked commit 0db2f1cd2adeabe55089b94458f5b70d58f7d281)

Needed-By: Ie289f5ca3d82a3150a0d0f8b8284385efe6ae4b2
Change-Id: I8377c1a846d29854cff623b1abaa467df50fcc28
(cherry picked from commit 04030115dbc2ba986529d7bb5a8f4dcd1d497aca)

Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to clients is slightly more complex than
services as the clients themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove monasca-log-api.

Change-Id: Iac96425ce785890b1bd06fe00f5b666a6ecdbc61

subject: Correctly set project_name
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-30 07:52:18.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lib/context.py'], 'message': "Correctly set project_name

With newer keystone middleware tenant* isn't set, project* is. The
current neutron logic assumes tenant is the good values, and that
project should mirror it, but that logic actually needs to be
inverted.

In order to minimally impact unit tests as operations, the strategy
here is to just prefer project_name, but fall back to tenant_name if
project_name isn't filled out (this should basically never be the
case).

With this project_name shows up in the context log lines in devstack
again (it's been missing for some time).

This was done in neutron in commit af6b9b36c59f40e2e9bf3917816b032e062b93ef.

Change-Id: I1bf87ea24a48c9ca7a8655f0d7b921c1725a83c3
"}]
commit_message:
Correctly set project_name

With newer keystone middleware tenant* isn't set, project* is. The
current neutron logic assumes tenant is the good values, and that
project should mirror it, but that logic actually needs to be
inverted.

In order to minimally impact unit tests as operations, the strategy
here is to just prefer project_name, but fall back to tenant_name if
project_name isn't filled out (this should basically never be the
case).

With this project_name shows up in the context log lines in devstack
again (it's been missing for some time).

This was done in neutron in commit af6b9b36c59f40e2e9bf3917816b032e062b93ef.

Change-Id: I1bf87ea24a48c9ca7a8655f0d7b921c1725a83c3

commit_message:
Eager load projects when getting types by group

Our VolumeType versioned object normally expects projects attribute to
be present in DB object. This commit makes sure it is loaded on the DB
side to prevent DetachedInstanceError when using
volume_type_get_all_by_group.

Change-Id: I14c6a441bb800a8b1d855e19bfb11bd6ed1266c9
Closes-Bug: 1659013

subject: Always acquire network.id lock in dhcp port update
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 4694, 'name': 'Miguel Lavalle', 'email': 'miguel@mlavalle.com', 'username': 'minsel'}, {'_account_id': 5948, 'name': 'Oleg Bondarev', 'email': 'obondarev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'obondarev'}, {'_account_id': 7016, 'name': 'Swaminathan Vasudevan', 'email': 'swvasude@cisco.com', 'username': 'souminathan'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14208, 'name': 'Cisco CI', 'email': 'ml2.ci@cisco.com', 'username': 'cisco_ml2_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-27 19:26:43.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/dhcp/agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/dhcp/test_agent.py'], 'message': "Always acquire network.id lock in dhcp port update

Looking at the cache before aqcuiring a lock may cause the
agent to mistakenly think the network doesn't exist when it
is actually being wired in parallel.

Always acquiring the network-based semaphore will ensure that
the network isn't currently being setup in another coroutine.

Closes-Bug: #1659919
Change-Id: I99ae71e3c5b1cd91dca3f6c80b04d2ecb79de64f
"}]
commit_message:
Always acquire network.id lock in dhcp port update

Looking at the cache before aqcuiring a lock may cause the
agent to mistakenly think the network doesn't exist when it
is actually being wired in parallel.

Always acquiring the network-based semaphore will ensure that
the network isn't currently being setup in another coroutine.

Closes-Bug: #1659919
Change-Id: I99ae71e3c5b1cd91dca3f6c80b04d2ecb79de64f

subject: Use admin credentials when available
revisions:
[{'number': 23, 'created': '2017-01-21 11:55:16.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_keystone_utils.py', 'hooks/keystone_utils.py', 'hooks/keystone_hooks.py', 'hooks/keystone_common.py', 'hooks/manager.py', 'unit_tests/test_manager.py', 'hooks/keystone_context.py'], 'message': 'Use admin credentials when available

The admin token is only intended to be used to bootstrap
a keystone server and it is preferred to use the admin
credentials for other admin operations. Some operations
are even expected to fail with the admin-token.

This patch checks if admin credentials have been generated
and use them if them if possible. Credentials are also
regularly validated by doing an initial token request to
keystone.

Closes-Bug: #1642979
Change-Id: I9102e2fb3631a6db7d9a2b0417bb91cabc878693
'}]
commit_message:
Use admin credentials when available

The admin token is only intended to be used to bootstrap
a keystone server and it is preferred to use the admin
credentials for other admin operations. Some operations
are even expected to fail with the admin-token.

This patch checks if admin credentials have been generated
and use them if them if possible. Credentials are also
regularly validated by doing an initial token request to
keystone.

Closes-Bug: #1642979
Change-Id: I9102e2fb3631a6db7d9a2b0417bb91cabc878693

[admin-guide] move default ports from config ref

Firewalls and default ports configuration is an administrative
tasks, and not OpenStack configuration options.
Also, we usually don't change the ports.

Change-Id: I0b5f488e8dfb89ce3bac52988e36768e765a01e3

commit_message:
Remove shared checkbox for non-admin users when doing network things.

Non-admin users are not allowed to touch the 'shared' checkbox when
creating or updating networks. It is better to make this invisible
to non-admin users instead of presenting it but not allowed to touch.

Change-Id: Ia5ed186b22f8658866c3a2b2acdde8053d176d81
Closes-Bug: #1651626

subject: Search bug links in testrail only in N days before
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-30 07:58:25.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/testrail/settings.py', 'fuelweb_test/testrail/testrail_client.py', 'fuelweb_test/testrail/report.py'], 'message': 'Search bug links in testrail only in N days before

For now there is over 200 requests in batch of 5 test runs iterating over all
created testplans, even older than half of year. Its absolutely not required
and testrail allow us to iterate through testplans created after date X.
We can use this feature and reduce time spent on useless get requests.

This patch introduces new variable TESTRAIL_DAYS_TO_ANALYZE that allow
us not to go too deep into testrail history. For now the default is 14 days.
It decreases uploading time from 20 minutes to 30-60 seconds and also reduces
load of testrail.

Change-Id: I468b14f6c5d6f8472b78980e3798f306068d3df2
(cherry picked from commit 2596c8d7960646ea204e3a67c2570bfbf8eeafe3)
'}]
commit_message:
Search bug links in testrail only in N days before

For now there is over 200 requests in batch of 5 test runs iterating over all
created testplans, even older than half of year. Its absolutely not required
and testrail allow us to iterate through testplans created after date X.
We can use this feature and reduce time spent on useless get requests.

This patch introduces new variable TESTRAIL_DAYS_TO_ANALYZE that allow
us not to go too deep into testrail history. For now the default is 14 days.
It decreases uploading time from 20 minutes to 30-60 seconds and also reduces
load of testrail.

Change-Id: I468b14f6c5d6f8472b78980e3798f306068d3df2

subject: Fix bound port left in DOWN state
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-25 20:37:33.000000000', 'files': ['networking_generic_switch/tests/unit/test_generic_switch_mech.py', 'networking_generic_switch/generic_switch_mech.py'], 'message': "Fix bound port left in DOWN state

This patch fixes an issue when we bound a port later than DHCP.
In this case provisioning is completed before port become bound and
it is not moved to ACTIVE state. When port is actually bound it is
not trigger port status update.
This patch adds new provisionig block 'GENERICSWITCH' before start
actual port binding, and complete provisioning for this block
in update_port_postcommit when port is in bound state it allows to
move it to ACTIVE.

Change-Id: I1b2adcabb8edae04785e4723bdec02a54cd7315f
"}]
commit_message:
Fix bound port left in DOWN state

This patch fixes an issue when we bound a port later than DHCP.
In this case provisioning is completed before port become bound and
it is not moved to ACTIVE state. When port is actually bound it is
not trigger port status update.
This patch adds new provisionig block 'GENERICSWITCH' before start
actual port binding, and complete provisioning for this block
in update_port_postcommit when port is in bound state it allows to
move it to ACTIVE.

Change-Id: I1b2adcabb8edae04785e4723bdec02a54cd7315f

subject: Use Request.path instead of rebuilding path from elements
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-29 17:53:05.000000000', 'files': ['storlets/swift_middleware/handlers/base.py', 'storlets/swift_middleware/handlers/obj.py', 'storlets/swift_middleware/handlers/proxy.py'], 'message': 'Use Request.path instead of rebuilding path from elements

In some logging, we create request path from account, container,
and object name, but it is inefficient because because we can get
whole request path as self.request.path.
This patch removes these path rebuilding.

NOTE:
This patch also removes some redundant log messages in swift
middleware.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I0f0771cf382369f37dc6a1248bd220f3b0ae83ec
'}]
commit_message:
Use Request.path instead of rebuilding path from elements

In some logging, we create request path from account, container,
and object name, but it is inefficient because because we can get
whole request path as self.request.path.
This patch removes these path rebuilding.

NOTE:
This patch also removes some redundant log messages in swift
middleware.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I0f0771cf382369f37dc6a1248bd220f3b0ae83ec

commit_message:
Delete the presence of default flavors

There are not any default flavors after the commit
"Remove flavor seeding from the base migration" which
removes default flavors from the database, that means
the new deploys will not have them(m1.tiny, m1.small,
m1.medium, m1.large, m1.xlarge).

Change-Id: Ifcdd6f1500a937de8dfd9d265bd5ee3406cb70e0
Closes-Bug: #1567009

If for some reason connectivity to the cluster goes down, we just return the
cached capacity info.  Then the scheduler still sees the cluster as an
available resource in the pool.

This change detects connectivity issues during the get_cluster_stats call and
if the call fails, we report 0 available capacity to keep create calls from
being scheduled to the cluster.

Change-Id: I3f730e140c2b61fdd407c90b134916108312278a
Closes-Bug: #1398877
'}]
commit_message:
Zero out SolidFire capacity when unreachable

If for some reason connectivity to the cluster goes down, we just return the
cached capacity info.  Then the scheduler still sees the cluster as an
available resource in the pool.

This change detects connectivity issues during the get_cluster_stats call and
if the call fails, we report 0 available capacity to keep create calls from
being scheduled to the cluster.

Change-Id: I3f730e140c2b61fdd407c90b134916108312278a
Closes-Bug: #1398877

subject: Replace six.iteritems() with .items()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-09 03:03:21.000000000', 'files': ['fuelmenu/modules/interfaces.py', 'fuelmenu/common/puppet.py', 'fuelmenu/common/modulehelper.py', 'fuelmenu/modules/bootstrapimg.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I2b2c1e76c4dda9a106ff3783fe882fb8a0f78112
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I2b2c1e76c4dda9a106ff3783fe882fb8a0f78112

commit_message:
Replaced e.message with str(e)

For logging the exception message: e.message has been
deprecated. The preferred way is to call str(e).
More details: https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0352/

Change-Id: I78cd4f52eece8c5f469131e21a7f897d1fd24dd3

commit_message:
Add mountable snapshots support

This new feature gives the user the ability to allow and
deny access to the snapshots, so that they could be mounted in
read-only mode to retrieve files.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Co-Authored-By: Rodrigo Barbieri <rodrigo.barbieri@fit-tecnologia.org.br>
Co-Authored-By: Alyson Rosa <alyson.rosa@fit-tecnologia.org.br>
Co-Authored-By: Miriam Yumi <miriam.peixoto@fit-tecnologia.org.br>

Partially-implements: blueprint manila-mountable-snapshots
Change-Id: I65f398a05f82eef31ec317d70dfa101483b44b30

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-27 12:50:06.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/testrail/settings.py', 'fuelweb_test/testrail/testrail_client.py', 'fuelweb_test/testrail/report.py'], 'message': 'Search bug links in testrail only in N days before

For now there is over 200 requests in batch of 5 test runs iterating over all
created testplans, even older than half of year. Its absolutely not required
and testrail allow us to iterate through testplans created after date X.
We can use this feature and reduce time spent on useless get requests.

This patch introduces new variable TESTRAIL_DAYS_TO_ANALYZE that allow
us not to go too deep into testrail history. For now the default is 14 days.
It decreases uploading time from 20 minutes to 30-60 seconds and also reduces
load of testrail.

Change-Id: I468b14f6c5d6f8472b78980e3798f306068d3df2
'}]
commit_message:
Search bug links in testrail only in N days before

For now there is over 200 requests in batch of 5 test runs iterating over all
created testplans, even older than half of year. Its absolutely not required
and testrail allow us to iterate through testplans created after date X.
We can use this feature and reduce time spent on useless get requests.

This patch introduces new variable TESTRAIL_DAYS_TO_ANALYZE that allow
us not to go too deep into testrail history. For now the default is 14 days.
It decreases uploading time from 20 minutes to 30-60 seconds and also reduces
load of testrail.

Change-Id: I468b14f6c5d6f8472b78980e3798f306068d3df2

commit_message:
Lock table and sync rule before each rule insert

In replicated PE mode, lock table and sync rule before each rule
insert to prevent conflicting rule from being inserted from another
policy engine.

Supported backends are MySQL and PostgreSQL
Manually tested with both backends.

TODO: add tempest scenarios to test recursion blocked
https://bugs.launchpad.net/congress/+bug/1655787

Closes-Bug: 1638746
Closes-Bug: 1637185

Change-Id: I29c6f63b467905c26fe1d35348a3b7a70d8414b6

subject: Remove 'X-Static-Large-Object' from .meta files
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-25 06:16:54.000000000', 'files': ['test/probe/common.py', 'swift/obj/server.py', 'test/probe/test_object_metadata_replication.py', 'swift/obj/diskfile.py'], 'message': "Remove 'X-Static-Large-Object' from .meta files

In current implementation, object-server copies 'X-Static-Large-Object'
from .data files of slo manifest objects to .meta files when users make
request of fast-POST. However, it will cause a problem in split brain
case as follows:

State1: An user PUT manifest object with t0 timestamp.

State2: Split brain happens.
    +--------------+--------------+
    |    brain1    |    brain2    |
    +--------------+--------------+
    | manifest(t0) | manifest(t0) |
    +--------------+--------------+

State3: An user PUT a new object which is not manifest
        in brain1 with t1 timestamp.
    +--------------+--------------+
    |    brain1    |    brain2    |
    +--------------+--------------+
    |  new_obj(t1) | manifest(t0) |
    +--------------+--------------+

State4: An user POST to the manifest in brain2 with t2 timestamp.
        In this case, the .meta file will have 'X-Static-Large-Object'
    +--------------+--------------+
    |    brain1    |    brain2    |
    +--------------+--------------+
    |  new_obj(t1) | manifest(t0) |
    |              |   .meta(t2)  |
    +--------------+--------------+

State5: Split brain is solved. The new object has
        'X-Static-Large-Object' nevertheless it is not manifest object.
    +-----------------------------+
    |         merged brain        |
    +-----------------------------+
    |          new_obj(t1)        |
    |           .meta(t2)         |
    +-----------------------------+

This patch changes handling of 'X-Static-Large-Object' metadata, and
fixes this bug.

Change-Id: Ic4ec0850b320907c52f6bc68f5588b3930d03c3d
Closes-Bug:#1634723
"}]
commit_message:
Remove 'X-Static-Large-Object' from .meta files

In current implementation, object-server copies 'X-Static-Large-Object'
from .data files of slo manifest objects to .meta files when users make
request of fast-POST. However, it will cause a problem in split brain
case as follows:

State1: An user PUT manifest object with t0 timestamp.

State2: Split brain happens.
    +--------------+--------------+
    |    brain1    |    brain2    |
    +--------------+--------------+
    | manifest(t0) | manifest(t0) |
    +--------------+--------------+

State3: An user PUT a new object which is not manifest
        in brain1 with t1 timestamp.
    +--------------+--------------+
    |    brain1    |    brain2    |
    +--------------+--------------+
    |  new_obj(t1) | manifest(t0) |
    +--------------+--------------+

State4: An user POST to the manifest in brain2 with t2 timestamp.
        In this case, the .meta file will have 'X-Static-Large-Object'
    +--------------+--------------+
    |    brain1    |    brain2    |
    +--------------+--------------+
    |  new_obj(t1) | manifest(t0) |
    |              |   .meta(t2)  |
    +--------------+--------------+

State5: Split brain is solved. The new object has
        'X-Static-Large-Object' nevertheless it is not manifest object.
    +-----------------------------+
    |         merged brain        |
    +-----------------------------+
    |          new_obj(t1)        |
    |           .meta(t2)         |
    +-----------------------------+

This patch changes handling of 'X-Static-Large-Object' metadata, and
fixes this bug.

Change-Id: Ic4ec0850b320907c52f6bc68f5588b3930d03c3d
Closes-Bug:#1634723

Magnum resources Bay and Baymodel is now renamed to Cluster and
ClusterTemplate respectively and which is deprecated. So this patch
implements new Magnum Resources: Cluster and ClusterTemplate.

commit_message:
Add new Magnum resources

Magnum resources Bay and Baymodel is now renamed to Cluster and
ClusterTemplate respectively and which is deprecated. So this patch
implements new Magnum Resources: Cluster and ClusterTemplate.
We can remove the old resources from heat when the support for
those resources is completely removed from Magnum.

Change-Id: I03379000350fde342cc7f6014d194a6438d6bdb5
TBD: Update the documents to add this new resources.

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-01-26 17:56:14.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/nimble.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_nimble.py'], 'message': 'Fix Qos for clone for Nimble Storage Driver

Currently the Qos is set only for the create volume.
The attribute needs to be overriden by the clone.
By default the clone inherits the attributes of the parent,
but if user needs to modify the Qos and Folder name of the child
(clone) they should be able to do it with this fix.

Change-Id: Ic30c1f386ee902333260fe23d57954ea021c24a4
Closes-Bug: #1659165
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Qos for clone for Nimble Storage Driver

Currently the Qos is set only for the create volume.
The attribute needs to be overriden by the clone.
By default the clone inherits the attributes of the parent,
but if user needs to modify the Qos and Folder name of the child
(clone) they should be able to do it with this fix.

Change-Id: Ic30c1f386ee902333260fe23d57954ea021c24a4
Closes-Bug: #1659165

commit_message:
Adds info to High Availability Guide in Pacemaker section.

A note regarding Pacemaker resources configuration is added.
If STONITH is enabled, it should have mechanisms configured, otherwise
Pacemaker won't allow to start its resources. An exmaple how to turn off
STONITH is added.

Change-Id: I97a0b271572c37472c0279f63f6c03a65db8a864
Closes-Bug: 1626711

commit_message:
Use network segmentation as identifier

Because ml2 is supported, network has segmentation id.
In this patch, we will use segmentation id
as network identifier instead of local network id.

Change-Id: I00a87019f450b1f33ed6941c299408f8c52abbed

subject: unwedge the gate
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-01-29 23:37:14.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/source/parameters.yaml', 'trove/tests/unittests/common/test_remote.py', 'trove/tests/util/__init__.py', 'trove/common/remote.py', 'api-ref/source/user-management.inc', 'trove/common/context.py'], 'message': 'unwedge the gate

This commit is a composite of two commits [1] and [2] to help unwedge
the gate. Both of them are required for the gate to possibly pass.

It introduces an unsafe change to unblock the gate temporarily. It
still needs to be debugged and addressed. The change in question is in
_remove_incompatible_context_args() in
trove/common/context.py. Without this check, initial tests indicate
that the system works as expected and testing locally is
successful. Why this is the case, I don't know yet but will
investigate in parallel.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/425857/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/423086/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/412497

From [1]

Fix a ``tox -eapi-ref`` warning

Currently, generating api-ref results in a warning that is treated as
an error.

See [1]. Since api-ref is now a jenkins voting gate, this needs to be
fixed.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/56/401456/9/check/gate-trove-api-ref/e2e0d9d/console.html#_2017-01-26_17_23_10_952073

From [2]

SessionClient' object has no attribute 'user' Now gate py27 and py34
are being error:'SessionClient' object has no attribute 'user'" I
observed that this is because novaclient from 6.0.0 into 7.0.0 caused,
In novaclient 7.0.0,password and username is merge to auth[1],[2], I
tried to make a change, get password and username from auth[3].

[1]:https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/6.0.0/novaclient/client.py#L164
[2]:https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/7.0.0/novaclient/client.py#L147
[3]:https://github.com/openstack/keystoneauth/blob/master/keystoneauth1/identity/generic/password.py#L37

Change-Id: I6fb2bdcc4b83457e08b24599fb4a297ef6ec6c14
Closes-Bug: #1657968
Co-Authored-By: Andrey Kurilin <akurilin@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: jiansong <jian.song@easystack.cn>
Co-Authored-By: Tin Lam <tinlam@gmail.com>
Related: I45a40d599b3a302726dc21e409a8da26c9f1f741
Related: I93c1942bb41bd77ea169f0e47d37132ce5d3637d
Related: I41f4144821e491da689c188e25bc2b916867bdca
'}]
commit_message:
unwedge the gate

This commit is a composite of two commits [1] and [2] to help unwedge
the gate. Both of them are required for the gate to possibly pass.

It introduces an unsafe change to unblock the gate temporarily. It
still needs to be debugged and addressed. The change in question is in
_remove_incompatible_context_args() in
trove/common/context.py. Without this check, initial tests indicate
that the system works as expected and testing locally is
successful. Why this is the case, I don't know yet but will
investigate in parallel.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/425857/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/423086/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/412497

From [1]

Fix a ``tox -eapi-ref`` warning

Currently, generating api-ref results in a warning that is treated as
an error.

See [1]. Since api-ref is now a jenkins voting gate, this needs to be
fixed.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/56/401456/9/check/gate-trove-api-ref/e2e0d9d/console.html#_2017-01-26_17_23_10_952073

From [2]

SessionClient' object has no attribute 'user' Now gate py27 and py34
are being error:'SessionClient' object has no attribute 'user'" I
observed that this is because novaclient from 6.0.0 into 7.0.0 caused,
In novaclient 7.0.0,password and username is merge to auth[1],[2], I
tried to make a change, get password and username from auth[3].

[1]:https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/6.0.0/novaclient/client.py#L164
[2]:https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/7.0.0/novaclient/client.py#L147
[3]:https://github.com/openstack/keystoneauth/blob/master/keystoneauth1/identity/generic/password.py#L37

Change-Id: I6fb2bdcc4b83457e08b24599fb4a297ef6ec6c14
Closes-Bug: #1657968
Co-Authored-By: Andrey Kurilin <akurilin@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: jiansong <jian.song@easystack.cn>
Co-Authored-By: Tin Lam <tinlam@gmail.com>
Related: I45a40d599b3a302726dc21e409a8da26c9f1f741
Related: I93c1942bb41bd77ea169f0e47d37132ce5d3637d
Related: I41f4144821e491da689c188e25bc2b916867bdca

commit_message:
Add a script to build an example cloud yaml

This ps generates a config file, with all the defaults commented
out. This makes it easier for a user to start using the helm
packages and start overriding the defaults.

Change-Id: I32129330287e49472ae955b11c060b5c14f0564b

commit_message:
Implement start_order for containers

Allow for ordering containers execution within the same step. This hook
uses `start_order` and it defaults to 0.

Co-Authored-by: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ib0804ee622e2889e6c18a76f07a194490f4721d4

subject: Fail lookup if the element we're testing has gone stale
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-23 04:57:01.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/test/integration_tests/basewebobject.py'], 'message': "Fail lookup if the element we're testing has gone stale

The StaleElementReferenceException indicates that the element
being tested has been deleted from the DOM since it was retrieved
from the browser (Selenium IPC round-trip to the browser means this
can be a significant delay making race conditions easy). Here we
catch the exception and return False (the text being tested for
is not present) which should allow _wait_until to continue testing
until the element is stable.

Change-Id: Ie41d4199545f81c91258aa856b929e07634f991b
Closes-Bug: 1626830
"}]
commit_message:
Fail lookup if the element we're testing has gone stale

The StaleElementReferenceException indicates that the element
being tested has been deleted from the DOM since it was retrieved
from the browser (Selenium IPC round-trip to the browser means this
can be a significant delay making race conditions easy). Here we
catch the exception and return False (the text being tested for
is not present) which should allow _wait_until to continue testing
until the element is stable.

Change-Id: Ie41d4199545f81c91258aa856b929e07634f991b
Closes-Bug: 1626830

subject: WIP: Save firefox binary logs to aid debugging
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-23 02:53:56.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/test/firefox_binary.py', 'tools/gate/integration/post_test_hook.sh'], 'message': 'WIP: Save firefox binary logs to aid debugging

WIP: currently saving to test_reports to check log generation

Currently we do not save the FirefoxBinary logs which
means we do not have information to potentially know
the cause of Firefox startup or communications failures.

Change-Id: I79d5d9601e6282ae91af45df86a2e68fefe91cd9
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Save firefox binary logs to aid debugging

WIP: currently saving to test_reports to check log generation

Currently we do not save the FirefoxBinary logs which
means we do not have information to potentially know
the cause of Firefox startup or communications failures.

Change-Id: I79d5d9601e6282ae91af45df86a2e68fefe91cd9

that can lead to misstated controller utilization values used by
the filter & goodness functions.

Closes-Bug: #1631460
Change-Id: Idf6a33a388e732acd2f3154ac7d0a6490f8cf88e

commit_message:
NetApp Data ONTAP headroom calculation error

The NetApp Data ONTAP drivers contain a minor calculation error
that can lead to misstated controller utilization values used by
the filter & goodness functions.

Closes-Bug: #1631460
Change-Id: Idf6a33a388e732acd2f3154ac7d0a6490f8cf88e
(cherry picked from commit f1bbaea40abf7d3a5a28320527db26e02add7d1f)

Also make sure bashate runs on init scripts that don't end
in .sh.

commit_message:
Switch to decorators.idempotent_id

test.idempotent_id is being kept temporary to migrate
to new lib interface. Now idempotent_id is available as Tempest stable
interface decorators and all plugins tests using the old decorator
should be switched to new interface.

In future, Once all plugins are switched to new decorator Tempest
will remove the test.idempotent_id

Change-Id: I90bc676111c023c8c682765412534eb1fba84db5
Related-Bug: 1616913

commit_message:
Fix class type error in attach_interface() function

In nova/virt/driver.py: ComputeDriver class has two functions
attach_interface() and detach_interface(), they all have
input param vif, but its type is not NetworkInfo but VIF,
this patch is to fix the tiny error in docs comments

Change-Id: Idb92c7b2f79efc57f70cd7747d1ff471dbf31bf4

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-01-12 07:02:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/hyperv/constants.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/block_device_mapping.py'], 'message': "Use JSON-Schema to validate bdm

device_type:cdrom,disk,floppy,fs,lun
delete_on_termination:boolean
disk_bus:
    libvirt/xenapi:fdc,ide,sata,scsi,usb,virtio,xen,lxc,uml
    vmware:ide,lsiLogic,busLogic,lsiLogicsas,paraVirtual
    hyperv:ide,scsi

update hpyerv disk bus constraints to lowcase 'ide' and 'scsi',
so the disk_bus will all defined in objects.filed.DiskBus and
objects.feild.SCSIModel.

hyperv driver finally call hyperv.vmops._get_disk_ctrl_and_solt
with disk_bus to get ide or scsi controler, update constraints to
lowcase does not impact anything.

Change-Id: If0634c8ca419fc6b4109fe8fcadeffadc77394c6
"}]
commit_message:
Use JSON-Schema to validate bdm

device_type:cdrom,disk,floppy,fs,lun
delete_on_termination:boolean
disk_bus:
    libvirt/xenapi:fdc,ide,sata,scsi,usb,virtio,xen,lxc,uml
    vmware:ide,lsiLogic,busLogic,lsiLogicsas,paraVirtual
    hyperv:ide,scsi

update hpyerv disk bus constraints to lowcase 'ide' and 'scsi',
so the disk_bus will all defined in objects.filed.DiskBus and
objects.feild.SCSIModel.

hyperv driver finally call hyperv.vmops._get_disk_ctrl_and_solt
with disk_bus to get ide or scsi controler, update constraints to
lowcase does not impact anything.

Change-Id: If0634c8ca419fc6b4109fe8fcadeffadc77394c6

commit_message:
Traceroute support

The virtual routers in Dragonflow don't support traceroute or its
backend network functionalities. This spec proposal a solution.

Change-Id: Id42b5a2330df1d3a44162b6f6e4c3506e54d93ed
Partially-implements: blueprint traceroute-support

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-01-23 22:43:46.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/resource_provider.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/client/test_report.py', 'nova/scheduler/client/report.py', 'nova/tests/functional/db/test_resource_provider.py'], 'message': 'placement: report client handle InventoryInUse

In a Newton deployment, Ironic baremetal nodes are added as resource
providers to the placement service. Those resource providers will
typically have 3 inventory records, one each for VCPU, MEMORY_MB, and
DISK_GB. In an Ocata deployment, the Nova resource tracker is going to
switch to tracking Ironic baremetal nodes having a single inventory
record corresponding to the Ironic node's "resource_class" attribute (a
custom resource class).

When this happens, we will need to rework allocation records against
that baremetal node provider since we will not be able to delete the
inventory records that refer to the old resource classes like VCPU,
MEMORY_MB and DISK_GB until those old allocation records are removed.

This patch catches the 409 Conflict returned from the placement service
when an InventoryInUse exception occurs and re-raises this exception on
the client side, allowing us a way in future patches to differentiate
between a ConcurrentUpdateDetected and the issue described above.

Change-Id: Ie52e495945b7b3db5ae777804c50260e3324e0ea
blueprint: custom-resource-classes
'}]
commit_message:
placement: report client handle InventoryInUse

In a Newton deployment, Ironic baremetal nodes are added as resource
providers to the placement service. Those resource providers will
typically have 3 inventory records, one each for VCPU, MEMORY_MB, and
DISK_GB. In an Ocata deployment, the Nova resource tracker is going to
switch to tracking Ironic baremetal nodes having a single inventory
record corresponding to the Ironic node's "resource_class" attribute (a
custom resource class).

When this happens, we will need to rework allocation records against
that baremetal node provider since we will not be able to delete the
inventory records that refer to the old resource classes like VCPU,
MEMORY_MB and DISK_GB until those old allocation records are removed.

This patch catches the 409 Conflict returned from the placement service
when an InventoryInUse exception occurs and re-raises this exception on
the client side, allowing us a way in future patches to differentiate
between a ConcurrentUpdateDetected and the issue described above.

Change-Id: Ie52e495945b7b3db5ae777804c50260e3324e0ea
blueprint: custom-resource-classes

commit_message:
Create tunnel port only once

Since df uses virtual tunnel port now, the tunnel port will not change
during the service running. So, no need to check and update tunnel port
during sync.

Change-Id: Ied831e11fe4087c034e70afad029d07bfe320b03
Closes-bug: #1656734

We should be using extension.ExtensionManager.make_test_instance
to set up the extensions like the one in:
Ie9af444e7f8842ffb3e275ede52b802de02e6e99

Just to get past the problem we have merging stevedore
upper constraints, filing this review

Change-Id: I141b17f9dd2acebe2b23f8fc93206e23bc70b568
'}]
commit_message:
Hack to support old and new stevedore

See Id675f335957a95fcfce61934dfbfbb2c64af761a, the
_find_entry_points is now list_entry_points.

We should be using extension.ExtensionManager.make_test_instance
to set up the extensions like the one in:
Ie9af444e7f8842ffb3e275ede52b802de02e6e99

Just to get past the problem we have merging stevedore
upper constraints, filing this review

Change-Id: I141b17f9dd2acebe2b23f8fc93206e23bc70b568

revisions:

We're seeing failures which seem to be due to the character length used
for jobs, but only on stable/newton:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/423201/

To be safe, this patch reduces the length of the job names for the
keystone scenarios within OpenStack-Ansible.

Change-Id: Ia803b95903005bbb318c9c96ba4e3b2f83f41c0b

commit_message:
Shorten Keystone scenarions for OpenStack-Ansible

We're seeing failures which seem to be due to the character length used
for jobs, but only on stable/newton:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/423201/

To be safe, this patch reduces the length of the job names for the
keystone scenarios within OpenStack-Ansible.

Change-Id: Ia803b95903005bbb318c9c96ba4e3b2f83f41c0b

subject: Skip unittests of glance if not related to code
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-27 22:03:00.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Skip unittests of glance if not related to code

On Glance gate, today unittests jobs run for patches which is not
related code. That wastes gate resources and developers need to wait
for much time even if they propose doc patches. This patch adds
all-files-match-any like the other projects.

Change-Id: Ib55439d93fb332e920482931f8ad81412e2b7ed9
'}]
commit_message:
Skip unittests of glance if not related to code

On Glance gate, today unittests jobs run for patches which is not
related code. That wastes gate resources and developers need to wait
for much time even if they propose doc patches. This patch adds
all-files-match-any like the other projects.

Change-Id: Ib55439d93fb332e920482931f8ad81412e2b7ed9

subject: Update volume type public status
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-29 09:54:23.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/volume/admin/test_volume_types.py'], 'message': 'Update volume type public status

This feature provides the ability to update the public status for a volume type.
This test case verifies this operation by the following steps:
1. Create a private volume type in admin tenant.
2. Update the volume type from private to public.
3. Create a volume from the volume type in primary tenant.

Change-Id: I8cc7e331bb891068de81e271536370ca018fbbe9
'}]
commit_message:
Update volume type public status

This feature provides the ability to update the public status for a volume type.
This test case verifies this operation by the following steps:
1. Create a private volume type in admin tenant.
2. Update the volume type from private to public.
3. Create a volume from the volume type in primary tenant.

Change-Id: I8cc7e331bb891068de81e271536370ca018fbbe9

2017-01-26 13:30:07.205 414713 ERROR gnocchi.storage._carbonara     (ones, values), names='b, v', formats='<?, <d')
2017-01-26 13:30:07.205 414713 ERROR gnocchi.storage._carbonara   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/numpy/core/records.py", line 544, in fromarrays
2017-01-26 13:30:07.205 414713 ERROR gnocchi.storage._carbonara     parsed = format_parser(formats, names, titles, aligned, byteorder)
2017-01-26 13:30:07.205 414713 ERROR gnocchi.storage._carbonara   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/numpy/core/records.py", line 145, in __init__
2017-01-26 13:30:07.205 414713 ERROR gnocchi.storage._carbonara     self._parseFormats(formats, aligned)
2017-01-26 13:30:07.205 414713 ERROR gnocchi.storage._carbonara   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/numpy/core/records.py", line 159, in _parseFormats
2017-01-26 13:30:07.205 414713 ERROR gnocchi.storage._carbonara     dtype = sb.dtype(formats, aligned)
2017-01-26 13:30:07.205 414713 ERROR gnocchi.storage._carbonara   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/numpy/core/_internal.py", line 171, in _commastring
2017-01-26 13:30:07.205 414713 ERROR gnocchi.storage._carbonara     (len(result)+1, astr))

This changes dtype instead of names and formats to pass the type.

commit_message:
carbonara: numpy 1.9 have some bug with ? for bool

2017-01-26 13:30:07.205 414713 ERROR gnocchi.storage._carbonara   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/carbonara.py", line 629, in serialize
2017-01-26 13:30:07.205 414713 ERROR gnocchi.storage._carbonara     (ones, values), names='b, v', formats='<?, <d')
2017-01-26 13:30:07.205 414713 ERROR gnocchi.storage._carbonara   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/numpy/core/records.py", line 544, in fromarrays
2017-01-26 13:30:07.205 414713 ERROR gnocchi.storage._carbonara     parsed = format_parser(formats, names, titles, aligned, byteorder)
2017-01-26 13:30:07.205 414713 ERROR gnocchi.storage._carbonara   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/numpy/core/records.py", line 145, in __init__
2017-01-26 13:30:07.205 414713 ERROR gnocchi.storage._carbonara     self._parseFormats(formats, aligned)
2017-01-26 13:30:07.205 414713 ERROR gnocchi.storage._carbonara   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/numpy/core/records.py", line 159, in _parseFormats
2017-01-26 13:30:07.205 414713 ERROR gnocchi.storage._carbonara     dtype = sb.dtype(formats, aligned)
2017-01-26 13:30:07.205 414713 ERROR gnocchi.storage._carbonara   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/numpy/core/_internal.py", line 171, in _commastring
2017-01-26 13:30:07.205 414713 ERROR gnocchi.storage._carbonara     (len(result)+1, astr))
2017-01-26 13:30:07.205 414713 ERROR gnocchi.storage._carbonara ValueError: format number 1 of "<?, <d" is not recognized

This changes dtype instead of names and formats to pass the type.

This have been fixed in 1.10.0:

https://github.com/numpy/numpy/commit/b68a522e9e3a7d04edf79ffa24c6637dcaaf8786

Change-Id: I428f65de8b7aae16f910f13b470da1d2361fd2ae

commit_message:
Switch ManageableSnaphots & ManageableVolumes list to OVO

Currently, the results from ManageableVolumes & ManageableSnapshots list
are being returned as Dict. This needs to be modeled as OVO as this
is being returned via rpc from the driver to the api layer.

We also change all occurences of List Manageable Volumes & snapshots to ovo

Change-Id: Id63e4c35deec6dccc0ae6a82b004618cd214d96e

commit_message:
Merge v21 view builder for flavor API

Now v2 and v2.1 code is merged and we do not need
to maintain the different set of view builder.
Previously there were different way of building the
complete response for flavor API. v2 used to do with extension
and v2.1 with view builder itself.

Part of bp:api-no-more-extensions

Change-Id: I4f8b6b6270ffc5aa64b5c9b936f61e0e96f7fe5b

revisions:
[{'number': 21, 'created': '2017-01-12 01:55:09.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_hostops.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_vmops.py', 'nova/virt/hyperv/vmops.py', 'nova/virt/hyperv/hostops.py', 'releasenotes/notes/hyper-v-vnuma-support-ffedfaadac91bbac.yaml'], 'message': 'Hyper-V: Adds vNUMA implementation

vNUMA can improve the performance of workloads running on virtual machines
that are configured with large amounts of memory. This feature is useful
for high-performance NUMA-aware applications, such as database or web
servers.

Returns Hyper-V host NUMA node information during get_available_resource
Adds validation for instances requiring NUMA topology (no asymmetric
topology and no CPU pinning supported).
Creates NUMA aware instances, if necessary.

The compute-cpu-topologies page in the admin-guide will have to be
updated to include Hyper-V NUMA topologies usage and configuration.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Iba2110e95e80b9511698cb7df2963fd218264c8e
Implements: blueprint hyper-v-vnuma-enable
'}]
commit_message:
Hyper-V: Adds vNUMA implementation

vNUMA can improve the performance of workloads running on virtual machines
that are configured with large amounts of memory. This feature is useful
for high-performance NUMA-aware applications, such as database or web
servers.

Returns Hyper-V host NUMA node information during get_available_resource
Adds validation for instances requiring NUMA topology (no asymmetric
topology and no CPU pinning supported).
Creates NUMA aware instances, if necessary.

The compute-cpu-topologies page in the admin-guide will have to be
updated to include Hyper-V NUMA topologies usage and configuration.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Iba2110e95e80b9511698cb7df2963fd218264c8e
Implements: blueprint hyper-v-vnuma-enable

subject: Adds missing steps to High Availability Guide.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-25 11:47:05.000000000', 'files': ['doc/ha-guide/source/controller-ha-pacemaker.rst', 'doc/ha-guide/source/controller-ha-haproxy.rst'], 'message': 'Adds missing steps to High Availability Guide.

This change affects Pacemaker and HAProxy part of the guide.
The Pacemaker, Corosync and pcsd should be enabled at system boot time by pcs.
The HAProxy needs a kernel parameter to bind to VIPs.

Change-Id: Ifd44d6c585efcf93c36b2570135223261b3188c3
Closes-Bug: 1626711
'}]
commit_message:
Adds missing steps to High Availability Guide.

This change affects Pacemaker and HAProxy part of the guide.
The Pacemaker, Corosync and pcsd should be enabled at system boot time by pcs.
The HAProxy needs a kernel parameter to bind to VIPs.

Change-Id: Ifd44d6c585efcf93c36b2570135223261b3188c3
Closes-Bug: 1626711

commit_message:
Periodic job fix 3

The previous PS's for the periodic jobs managed to successfully
build and upload the docker tarballs, but failed to compress it
due to an ordering issue. This PS fixes the order.

Change-Id: I752f753c71dfd403770f390ec84f03556d8a7ae7

commit_message:
Switch to decorators.idempotent_id

test.idempotent_id is being kept temporary to migrate
to new lib interface. Now idempotent_id is available as Tempest stable
interface decorators and all plugins tests using the old decorator
should be switched to new interface.

In future, Once all plugins are switched to new decorator Tempest
will remove the test.idempotent_id

Change-Id: I48b65c32f3344380b91fcecb016e3f04546b2234
Related-Bug: 1616913

[{'number': 12, 'created': '2017-01-11 22:51:11.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': "Don't bypass cellsv1 replication if cellsv2 maps are in place

When we start creating the cellsv2 mappings in the cellsv1 devstack
job, we need to avoid that causing us to circumvent the top-level
merged replica of the cell databases. Doing this causes us to return
stale information that has not yet been updated by cells replication.

Change-Id: Icfbb17cce8ce8b03dc8b7b4ffb202db01e5218a6
"}]
commit_message:
Don't bypass cellsv1 replication if cellsv2 maps are in place

When we start creating the cellsv2 mappings in the cellsv1 devstack
job, we need to avoid that causing us to circumvent the top-level
merged replica of the cell databases. Doing this causes us to return
stale information that has not yet been updated by cells replication.

Change-Id: Icfbb17cce8ce8b03dc8b7b4ffb202db01e5218a6

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-24 21:48:15.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/rpc.py', 'cinder/scheduler/rpcapi.py', 'cinder/volume/rpcapi.py'], 'message': "Add assert_min_rpc_version decorator

We have multiple places in RPC APIs where we're blocking sending RPC
calls if version cap is set to value lower than our minimal version.
This commit implements this consistently by adding a reusable decorator
that can be used with RPC API methods.

Change-Id: I11c0d79c45294bd412feffd4b301359254d2e143
"}]
commit_message:
Add assert_min_rpc_version decorator

We have multiple places in RPC APIs where we're blocking sending RPC
calls if version cap is set to value lower than our minimal version.
This commit implements this consistently by adding a reusable decorator
that can be used with RPC API methods.

Change-Id: I11c0d79c45294bd412feffd4b301359254d2e143

This branch adds a new ViF driver to the Nova Hyper-V compute driver.
It's responsible for creating the OVS port and the related association
with the Hyper-V virtual switch port. Aside from the openvswitch binaries
it has no other dependencies. Flow rules are added by an external agent
such as OpenDaylight or by a Neutron OVS agent.

Change-Id: I4cee52f65968fa503f2c8a2c9a206489719fb15a

commit_message:
Adds Hyper-V OVS ViF driver

This branch adds a new ViF driver to the Nova Hyper-V compute driver.
It's responsible for creating the OVS port and the related association
with the Hyper-V virtual switch port. Aside from the openvswitch binaries
it has no other dependencies. Flow rules are added by an external agent
such as OpenDaylight or by a Neutron OVS agent.

The new VIF driver is using os-vif in order to create the OVS ports.

Co-Authored-By: Adelina Tuvenie <atuvenie@cloudbasesolutions.com>
Co-Authored-By: Claudiu Belu <cbelu@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Depends-On: Ia07ade945ca7469b9c23c801a6bfe08135d39466
Depends-On: Ia33e76a28f96fb94e6fdeedc4947b8a353e3d5bc

Implements: blueprint hyper-v-ovs-vif

Change-Id: I4cee52f65968fa503f2c8a2c9a206489719fb15a
