commit_message:
Added support for meta variable JSON files

Syntribos now allows the user to specify variables in their request
templates by reading from a meta.json file. This is part 1 of 3 of
the full effort, dealing primarily with the template parser itself.

Change-Id: Id41d331f595cd3bc32f085ef49cb5d1b16779a5c

subject: cleanup noauth path
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-25 20:33:16.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': "cleanup noauth path

- we don't need to set keystone_authtoken values
- setting OS_AUTH_TYPE breaks all other clients since it's global
  so just leave it and let user set to client specifically. this
  will not make integration gate work with noauth as there are other
  commands which require gnocchi to be registered in catalog

Change-Id: I3f451a40cdda12072daa69744467403236f633a7
"}]
commit_message:
cleanup noauth path

- we don't need to set keystone_authtoken values
- setting OS_AUTH_TYPE breaks all other clients since it's global
  so just leave it and let user set to client specifically. this
  will not make integration gate work with noauth as there are other
  commands which require gnocchi to be registered in catalog

Change-Id: I3f451a40cdda12072daa69744467403236f633a7

commit_message:
Switch to decorators.idempotent_id

test.idempotent_id is being kept temporary to migrate
to new lib interface. Now idempotent_id is available as Tempest stable
interface decorators and all plugins tests using the old decorator
should be switched to new interface.

In future, Once all plugins are switched to new decorator Tempest
will remove the test.idempotent_id

Change-Id: I79b83e06300d34f6a5966bb4e578d6554c0ea662
Related-Bug: 1616913

revisions:

on the config drive in addition to the metadata server.

Change-Id: Ic8f065bfd77dd4c533590a023bab8b1d32da1f53
'}]
commit_message:
Support SSH keys from config drive

Add kernel support for IDE CDROM drives, add a package for JSON
parsing, and updating the metadata script to look for SSH keys
on the config drive in addition to the metadata server.

Change-Id: Ic8f065bfd77dd4c533590a023bab8b1d32da1f53

commit_message:
Remove Link class

This patch removes the link class since there is no need
of class and link can be created by method only. This patch
also removes the old validation methods which were done prior to
JSONSchema.

Partially-Implements: BP api-json-input-validation
Change-Id: I20a307fe83c54912ccf3d92d6b47e97ffeeec121

subject: Tunneling application
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-01-26 12:50:49.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/tests/unit/test_tunneling_app.py', 'devstack/plugin.sh', 'dragonflow/controller/l2_app.py', 'dragonflow/controller/tunneling_app.py', 'dragonflow/tests/unit/test_l2_app.py'], 'message': 'Tunneling application

The tunneling application takes care of tunneling specific
flows.implements tunneling spec
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/dragonflow/+spec/Tunneling-app.
The tunneling app is improving L2 modularity.
patch include:
*Unit test for the tunneling app
*Remove tunneling related funtionality from l2 app
*Fix l2 unit tests to reflect le modifications
 After removing tunneling flows the old l2 unit tests
 became irrelevant

Change-Id: I4c078abeaddccceaa0a1971301a2d874ef0ae0b3
'}]
commit_message:
Tunneling application

The tunneling application takes care of tunneling specific
flows.implements tunneling spec
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/dragonflow/+spec/Tunneling-app.
The tunneling app is improving L2 modularity.
patch include:
*Unit test for the tunneling app
*Remove tunneling related funtionality from l2 app
*Fix l2 unit tests to reflect le modifications
 After removing tunneling flows the old l2 unit tests
 became irrelevant

Change-Id: I4c078abeaddccceaa0a1971301a2d874ef0ae0b3

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-01-23 10:51:19.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/falconstor/fss_common.py'], 'message': 'FalconStor: Drop the copy_image_to_volume feature

The inheritance class changed and the implementation layer at os_brick.
FSS is not a NFS storage so we drop it.

Change-Id: I200eac3ff7e7dd5da893cce527a2d5491ff07a87
Closes-Bug: #1614350
'}]
commit_message:
FalconStor: Drop the copy_image_to_volume feature

The inheritance class changed and the implementation layer at os_brick.
FSS is not a NFS storage so we drop it.

Change-Id: I200eac3ff7e7dd5da893cce527a2d5491ff07a87
Closes-Bug: #1614350

subject: Add user_id in receiver list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-28 09:35:12.000000000', 'files': ['senlinclient/v1/receiver.py', 'senlinclient/v1/shell.py'], 'message': 'Add user_id in receiver list

This patch adds the "user_id" column in receiver list.

Change-Id: Ic6a635cc652e4a7356cdd5984099e0c174f330fc
Closes-Bug: #1653579
(cherry picked from commit a834bf97e34a76ccfd471b7af24f98218ce0adde)
'}]
commit_message:

commit_message:
Deprecate [security_compliance]\password_expires_ignore_user_ids

Deprecate [security_compliance]\password_expires_ignore_user_ids in
favor of using the new user-option 'ignore_password_expiry'.

This allows setting the value for ignoring password expiration on
individual users without needing to restart keystone for each change
to the list.

Partial-Bug: 1659995

Change-Id: Ib4b422ab07f91c312f3268ade926db1638052587

commit_message:
enforce running multi-input on the proxy

Now, multi-input storlet(with 'X-Storlet-Extra-Resources') runs
on object-server side.
but it causes that specified extra resources get ignored,
as current object-server does not support X-Storlet-Extra-Resources.

This patch forces multi-input storlet to run on proxy-server side.

Change-Id: I7fc2e72c3f39b5461f502ef314d0aba5686aa3f7
Closes-Bug: #1657044

subject: Raise AssertionError instead of eventlet.timeout.Timeout when failing.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-18 16:02:47.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/tempest/api/test_routers.py'], 'message': "Raise AssertionError instead of eventlet.timeout.Timeout when failing.

The eventlet.timeout.Timeout exception subclasses Python's BaseException.
This is problematic because that is a higher category exception than
Python's Exception. As a result of this type of exception being raised
during testing, this halts the normal test flow.
AssertionError will properly mark a test as failed.

Change-Id: Iaf74f877f6a70c0383d539e9b01d6db2ec0ddeca
Closes-Bug: 1654283
(cherry picked from commit 161e5809a690d7c974a3a340b56273b8a66a6f16)
"}]
commit_message:
Raise AssertionError instead of eventlet.timeout.Timeout when failing.

The eventlet.timeout.Timeout exception subclasses Python's BaseException.
This is problematic because that is a higher category exception than
Python's Exception. As a result of this type of exception being raised
during testing, this halts the normal test flow.
AssertionError will properly mark a test as failed.

Change-Id: Iaf74f877f6a70c0383d539e9b01d6db2ec0ddeca
Closes-Bug: 1654283
(cherry picked from commit 161e5809a690d7c974a3a340b56273b8a66a6f16)

subject: do not mock private methods of objects from libraries
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-28 01:47:50.000000000', 'files': ['glance/common/glare/loader.py', 'glance/tests/functional/glare/test_glare.py'], 'message': "do not mock private methods of objects from libraries

This patch fixes tests that were using mock to replace a private method
of a library instead of using the public testing interface provided by
that library. The new release of stevedore changes the name of that
private method, which breaks these tests. Because the requirements list
is gated on glance's unit tests, the test failure is preventing other
projects from adopting the new release of stevedore.

Change-Id: Ie9af444e7f8842ffb3e275ede52b802de02e6e99
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
do not mock private methods of objects from libraries

This patch fixes tests that were using mock to replace a private method
of a library instead of using the public testing interface provided by
that library. The new release of stevedore changes the name of that
private method, which breaks these tests. Because the requirements list
is gated on glance's unit tests, the test failure is preventing other
projects from adopting the new release of stevedore.

Change-Id: Ie9af444e7f8842ffb3e275ede52b802de02e6e99
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Use oslo.log library instead of system logging module

The constants of log levels were added in the 1.8 version of
the oslo.log library. So we can replace all usage of system
logging module with log module from oslo.log.

Change-Id: I6cd5f01db210a5f16232e6fb8649b4e7866af158

commit_message:
Use oslo.log library instead of system logging module

The constants of log levels were added in the 1.8 version of
the oslo.log library. So we can replace all usage of system
logging module with log module from oslo.log.

Change-Id: Ie9f91124c1aeb9e91aa52f005a428561109145f0

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2417, 'name': 'Ben Swartzlander', 'email': 'ben@swartzlander.org', 'username': 'bswartz'}, {'_account_id': 6413, 'name': 'Victoria Martinez de la Cruz', 'email': 'victoria@redhat.com', 'username': 'vkmc'}, {'_account_id': 11047, 'name': 'Mark Sturdevant', 'email': 'mark.sturdevant@ibm.com', 'username': 'markstur'}, {'_account_id': 16643, 'name': 'Goutham Pacha Ravi', 'email': 'gouthampravi@gmail.com', 'username': 'gouthamr'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-27 21:22:21.000000000', 'files': ['conf/uclibc.config', 'doc/configuring.txt', 'conf/busybox.config'], 'message': "Don't strip comments out of config files

It turns out that Kconfig actually needs the comments in the
config files to work properly, so add them back in.

Also add iproute2 support to busybox because it's very helpful
for debugging.

Change-Id: Ie6f7b61218bff135f0ac3ccba387e148019eed4f
"}]
commit_message:
Don't strip comments out of config files

It turns out that Kconfig actually needs the comments in the
config files to work properly, so add them back in.

Also add iproute2 support to busybox because it's very helpful
for debugging.

Change-Id: Ie6f7b61218bff135f0ac3ccba387e148019eed4f

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-27 06:12:23.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/tempest/api/test_telemetry_notification_api.py', 'ceilometer/tests/tempest/scenario/test_object_storage_telemetry_middleware.py'], 'message': 'Switch to decorators.idempotent_id

test.idempotent_id is being kept temporary to migrate
to new lib interface. Now idempotent_id is available as Tempest stable
interface decorators and all plugins tests using the old decorator
should be switched to new interface.

In future, Once all plugins are switched to new decorator Tempest
will remove the test.idempotent_id

Change-Id: I91d897b35aa1d4c00971d9f573db0a23e6af9e32
Related-Bug: 1616913

commit_message:
Switch to decorators.idempotent_id

test.idempotent_id is being kept temporary to migrate
to new lib interface. Now idempotent_id is available as Tempest stable
interface decorators and all plugins tests using the old decorator
should be switched to new interface.

In future, Once all plugins are switched to new decorator Tempest
will remove the test.idempotent_id

Change-Id: I91d897b35aa1d4c00971d9f573db0a23e6af9e32
Related-Bug: 1616913

subject: Add cluster_operation and node_operation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-13 06:47:16.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/cluster/v1/cluster.py', 'openstack/cluster/v1/_proxy.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/cluster/v1/test_node.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/cluster/v1/test_proxy.py', 'openstack/cluster/v1/node.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/cluster/v1/test_cluster.py'], 'message': "Add cluster_operation and node_operation

This patch adds the support to 'cluster_operation' and 'node_operation'
which were added in Senlin API microversion 1.4. These APIs enable a
user to perform any operation that are provided by a backend service but
not directly modeled by Senlin clustering service.

Change-Id: I40e228227accac066b218b14227ae7904a270468
"}]
commit_message:
Add cluster_operation and node_operation

This patch adds the support to 'cluster_operation' and 'node_operation'
which were added in Senlin API microversion 1.4. These APIs enable a
user to perform any operation that are provided by a backend service but
not directly modeled by Senlin clustering service.

Change-Id: I40e228227accac066b218b14227ae7904a270468

subject: newton/scenario001: enable ceph
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-27 22:19:55.000000000', 'files': ['ci/environments/scenario001-multinode.yaml'], 'message': "newton/scenario001: enable ceph

I can't figure why we didn't enabled Ceph on scenario001 but it seems
reasonable to have it, it will be helpful to test upgrades of
scenario001 from newton to ocata if Ceph is already enabled.

The main difference is that we don't enable RBD backend for Gnocchi, as
we have a problem in Newton, that we never figured yet.

Change-Id: I38ba43f4047b1032e798986bca1cd5d5e74741ec
"}]
commit_message:
newton/scenario001: enable ceph

I can't figure why we didn't enabled Ceph on scenario001 but it seems
reasonable to have it, it will be helpful to test upgrades of
scenario001 from newton to ocata if Ceph is already enabled.

The main difference is that we don't enable RBD backend for Gnocchi, as
we have a problem in Newton, that we never figured yet.

Change-Id: I38ba43f4047b1032e798986bca1cd5d5e74741ec

commit_message:
Fix address scope list --share

Remove the 'shared' key from the attrs passed in to the SDK with 0.9.13.

Also convert the functional tests to the JSON-style (that's how I found this).

Closes-bug: 1659993
Change-Id: I614fbce967cdd07fe7360242547dbf52e7677939

commit_message:
Extracted HTTP response codes to constants

There are several places in the source code where HTTP response
codes are used as numeric values.

Status codes 200, 201, and 202 under api/contrib are replaced with
symbolic constants from six.moves.http_client thus improves code
readability. More patches will be submitted to address other status
codes.

Partial-Bug: #1520159

Change-Id: I944ab762a268886715b37bed1704e4fd56dae4fb

subject: Enable multinode on neutron-multinode-live-migration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-28 03:16:25.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': 'Enable multinode on neutron-multinode-live-migration

As [1] mail, the neutron-multinode-live-migration always fails now
because live_migration is False on tempest.conf.
devstack-gate sets it as False if all-in-one setting. So this patch
makes the job setting multinode as its name.

[1]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-January/111137.html

Change-Id: I2343473ee277d0f5be5dff7ab377f58b219108a5
'}]
commit_message:
Enable multinode on neutron-multinode-live-migration

As [1] mail, the neutron-multinode-live-migration always fails now
because live_migration is False on tempest.conf.
devstack-gate sets it as False if all-in-one setting. So this patch
makes the job setting multinode as its name.

[1]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-January/111137.html

Change-Id: I2343473ee277d0f5be5dff7ab377f58b219108a5

subject: Fixes deprecations caused by latest oslo.context
revisions:

In oslo.context 2.12.0 a number of things used by keystone

Change-Id: I885431ba957909e709648e03a05bc280441ffbf5

commit_message:
Fixes deprecations caused by latest oslo.context

In oslo.context 2.12.0 a number of things used by keystone
were deprecated. This causes the keystone tests to fail
since we treat deprecation as errors.

Change-Id: I885431ba957909e709648e03a05bc280441ffbf5

commit_message:
ceph: set return limit

when grabbing metrics to process, we only grab a chunk. there's no
point grabbing uncapped amount and taking small chunk near front.

Change-Id: I9ac64037705f08a3133f6d845ced516aab50d40f

commit_message:
Reuse already existing groups from upstream tempest config

Tempest plugin tests uses the same config file/object from the
upstream tempest, therefore instead of registering the same group
again in plugin tests we should reuse already existing groups and
register only plugin specific option here.

Change-Id: I948fdcf20732b98d5ba5d34fe0352ea9cff59f91
Closes-Bug: #1659596

commit_message:
add additional deprecation warnings for KVS options

We had a single deprecation warning for KVS functionality being
removed in Pike, located at keystone/common/kvs/core.py [1]

This change adds deprecation warnings to the various config
options and backends that used core.py.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/common/kvs/core.py#L98-L101

Related-Bug: 1077282

bp deprecated-as-of-ocata

Change-Id: Ia63f0ac8543cf1e938baa712e21f08f582dc26ed

Add networking guide link for README

README now does not have networking network guide link.

2. What is the solution to the problem
Add the network guide link to the README

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
No new features

commit_message:
Deprecate `ignore_password_expire_user_ids` conf option

The configuration option has been deprecated in favour of the new
value on the User object `ignore_password_expiry` that can be set
with a call to `update_user` and does not require a restart of the
Keystone server when changing the values. The reasoning for this
change is to support and maintain better architecture and avoid
blurring the lines (further) between configuration and
runtime/administrative data within Keystone.

Change-Id: I089d20edccd76562f9f896afd13ab04545b02bfa

commit_message:
PCI-DSS Force users to change password upon first use

"PCI-DSS 8.2.6 Set passwords/passphrases for first-time use and
upon reset to a unique value for each user, and change immediately after
the first use" [1].

I'll update the docs in a subsequent patch.

[1] https://www.pcisecuritystandards.org/documents/PCI_DSS_v3-1.pdf

Closes-Bug: #1645487
Change-Id: I5575dbd6d63d41014a7468acd6bdf0175d791618

commit_message:
Add new configuration option live_migration_scheme

This change adds a new configuration option to change scheme that is used
for live migrations. The change also deprecates old live_migration_uri
in favor of two other flags:

* live_migraton_inbound_addr to configure live migration target URI
* live_migration_scheme to change scheme used for live migration

The new configuration option does not break backward compatibility as
it does not override scheme set in live_migration_uri.

Change-Id: I38b3d1d42b2ffc4a2f6d7398061829d3c745b9a1

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-10 04:43:40.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l2/extensions/qos.py'], 'message': "Disables QoS policy pull optimization for following reasons:

1. It is not safe to assume that the port will always get
   scheduled on same compute.
2. It assumes that the rules under policy did not change
   between prev instance delete and new instance create.
3. It doesn't pull port policy when same port is used for
   booting different instance (after prev instance is deleted)
4. Disabling this code allows pull of policy and proper
   enforcement of policy to the port.

Change-Id: Iffad16f491fa75c9ae744805ff472bd3c0522936
Closes-Bug: #1515533
"}]
commit_message:
Disables QoS policy pull optimization for following reasons:

1. It is not safe to assume that the port will always get
   scheduled on same compute.
2. It assumes that the rules under policy did not change
   between prev instance delete and new instance create.
3. It doesn't pull port policy when same port is used for
   booting different instance (after prev instance is deleted)
4. Disabling this code allows pull of policy and proper
   enforcement of policy to the port.

Change-Id: Iffad16f491fa75c9ae744805ff472bd3c0522936
Closes-Bug: #1515533

For gate jobs, we need to automate the installing of
dependencies, so check if we're on Ubuntu and handle that

Change-Id: Id2c6a815c018cdfe3b288c38c7033275f25d8f13

commit_message:
Install packages automatically on Ubuntu

For gate jobs, we need to automate the installing of
dependencies, so check if we're on Ubuntu and handle that
case automatically. Other distros can still use the script
but need to manually take care of dependencies.

Change-Id: Id2c6a815c018cdfe3b288c38c7033275f25d8f13

openstackSDK releases (0.9.11 and 0.9.12) and requires the latest

commit_message:
bump openstacksdk minimum to 0.9.13

The OSC team addressed the issues that were discovered in the latest
openstackSDK releases (0.9.11 and 0.9.12) and requires the latest
version of the sdk (0.9.13)

Additioanlly, the senlinclient project also needs to use the latest
sdk as well.

Change-Id: I7fbf1f4e5857ce936330c6f7e3a3ef531a6782f0

commit_message:
remove NetworkDuplicated exception

b06867c581541ed325ddc5e5b5a2d53b1b0261ac removed check and said:
Removed neutron.allow_duplicate_networks config option. The
behavior in Liberty is now to simply allow duplicate
networks. so we don't need to catch this exception anymore.

Change-Id: I4c39436d5481bd019f63b4d8c09ad055e9b217d0

Implements: blueprint vmax-compression-support
'}]
commit_message:
VMAX driver - Support for compression on All Flash.

Compression is enabled by default on an VMAX All Flash.
This feature allows the user to create different storage groups
with compression disabled, if the user requires it.

Change-Id: I28ecb0a9975ae9a6ec46f0a48135a295f6a398da
Implements: blueprint vmax-compression-support

subject: stop tracing db queries
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-27 16:07:22.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'message': "stop tracing db queries

We're no longer even collecting mysql logs at this point (not sure
when that broke, but they aren't anywhere to be found), so doing all
the extra work for query logging seems like a way to just slow things
down and possibly drive mysql into crazy land.

Change-Id: I5e030dfcb93b581e9424373674f94278cbbc58f6
"}]
commit_message:
stop tracing db queries

We're no longer even collecting mysql logs at this point (not sure
when that broke, but they aren't anywhere to be found), so doing all
the extra work for query logging seems like a way to just slow things
down and possibly drive mysql into crazy land.

Change-Id: I5e030dfcb93b581e9424373674f94278cbbc58f6

The KOLLA_KUBERNETES_VERSION variable was mispelled causing
all sorts of problems.  The variable is also a misnomer - instead
it shoud be KUBERNETES_VERSION.  This triggers a natural change
rom KOLLA_HELM_VERSION to HELM_VERSION as well.

Change-Id: Iaa094b479b5b1197885ee213a360a80cc3612ed8
'}]
commit_message:
Fix documentation error in development environment

The KOLLA_KUBERNETES_VERSION variable was mispelled causing
all sorts of problems.  The variable is also a misnomer - instead
it shoud be KUBERNETES_VERSION.  This triggers a natural change
rom KOLLA_HELM_VERSION to HELM_VERSION as well.

Change-Id: Iaa094b479b5b1197885ee213a360a80cc3612ed8

commit_message:
Use weakrefs for common_db_mixin callbacks

This will prevent the common_db_mixin dictionary
extension functions and query hooks from stopping
the GC of plugins in tests and causing resource leaks.

Change-Id: I7576851a44abd14cbc337a3d3e28690c7316ec81

commit_message:
Don't assume nova-manage is present

tools/discover_hosts.sh is run by devstack-gate, and breaks all dsvm job
that doesn't use nova.

nova-manage is perhaps not installed if nova services are not enabled.

This change checks the presence of nova-.

Change-Id: Ic555d241f98d0fa027897c69a7115d1be88f6c96

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-26 15:56:18.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/federation/utils.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/mapping_fixtures.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/contrib/federation/test_utils.py'], 'message': 'Catch potential SyntaxError in federation mapping

When using the 'groups' keyword in a federation mapping, the value
passed in the assertion map be a simple string with a space. For
example, "ALL USERS". This results in ast.literal_eval() raising
a SyntaxError and not ValueError, which bubbles up to the API as
an uncaught 500 Internal Server Error.

Change-Id: I61f93a6c54b62ba8719d2603f93dc18c33b581ce
Closes-Bug: #1629446
(cherry picked from commit 9e1e2c2156f365078085db54dfbbfff50e2c2b84)
'}]
commit_message:
Catch potential SyntaxError in federation mapping

When using the 'groups' keyword in a federation mapping, the value
passed in the assertion map be a simple string with a space. For
example, "ALL USERS". This results in ast.literal_eval() raising
a SyntaxError and not ValueError, which bubbles up to the API as
an uncaught 500 Internal Server Error.

Change-Id: I61f93a6c54b62ba8719d2603f93dc18c33b581ce
Closes-Bug: #1629446

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-26 15:57:22.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/federation/utils.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/mapping_fixtures.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/contrib/federation/test_utils.py'], 'message': 'Catch potential SyntaxError in federation mapping

When using the 'groups' keyword in a federation mapping, the value
passed in the assertion map be a simple string with a space. For
example, "ALL USERS". This results in ast.literal_eval() raising
a SyntaxError and not ValueError, which bubbles up to the API as
an uncaught 500 Internal Server Error.

Change-Id: I61f93a6c54b62ba8719d2603f93dc18c33b581ce
Closes-Bug: #1629446
(cherry picked from commit 9e1e2c2156f365078085db54dfbbfff50e2c2b84)
'}]
commit_message:
Catch potential SyntaxError in federation mapping

When using the 'groups' keyword in a federation mapping, the value
passed in the assertion map be a simple string with a space. For
example, "ALL USERS". This results in ast.literal_eval() raising
a SyntaxError and not ValueError, which bubbles up to the API as
an uncaught 500 Internal Server Error.

Change-Id: I61f93a6c54b62ba8719d2603f93dc18c33b581ce
Closes-Bug: #1629446
(cherry picked from commit 9e1e2c2156f365078085db54dfbbfff50e2c2b84)

commit_message:
Address follow-up comments from previous patchset

There were a couple comments about making minor changes in the patch
set for changing change_password to not require a token. These comments
mentioned fixing the wording on the change_user api-ref note and
adding an additional assertion for one of the added unit tests.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/404022/

This change corrects the wording in the api-ref note for
change_password about not needing an authentication token and
adds an additional assertion for changing an expired password to
verify that once an expired password is successfully changed, the
user is able to authenticate and create a token.

Change-Id: I8e557d344ee77e0c9c28391d3ef09913bd87fef6

commit_message:
Add debugging information for bmc issues

Save the end of the bmc console log so we can look for issues.  This
will not be visible in the job logs, but is on the te-broker so
ci-admins can debug the problem.

Change-Id: I9f2f21f9e723c5e01532b74ba2b4617a2bc046dd
Related-Bug: 1657188

commit_message:
devstack: show info even after tempest fails

For debugging purpose, some ovs related info are shown after tempests
run. But it doesn't when tempests fails with error.
Make it sure that those info are shown even when tempests ended with
error. And also show full ovsdb contents.

Change-Id: Iac677979d63f5558537d641fa49824ad54c7c4fe

subject: Add a script to zero /etc/sysconfig/ip6tables at build time
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-27 10:03:43.000000000', 'files': ['elements/iptables/install.d/99-empty-iptables'], 'message': 'Add a script to zero /etc/sysconfig/ip6tables at build time

In change Iddc21316a1a3d42a1a43cbb4b9c178adba8f8db3 we zeroed out
/etc/sysconfig/iptables, but we did not take care of ipv6. This change
is meant to take of the ipv6 part of the problem.
When including this element we empty the stock /etc/sysconfig/ip6tables
file as shipped by the iptables rpm package. The reason for this is that
puppet firewall has a hard time to cope with exiting rules when
/etc/sysconfig/iptables is populated and the iptables service is not
active. The referenced bug has a full explanation for the problem.

Note that ipv6 is slightly more delicate because we will also need a puppet-tripleo
change that implements the dhcpv6 rule that is contained by default
in /etc/sysconfig/ip6tables:
Depends-On: If22080054b2b1fa7acfd101e8c34d2707e8e7864

Change-Id: I0dee5ff045fbfe7b55d078583e16b107eec534aa
Partial-Bug: #1657108
'}]
commit_message:
Add a script to zero /etc/sysconfig/ip6tables at build time

In change Iddc21316a1a3d42a1a43cbb4b9c178adba8f8db3 we zeroed out
/etc/sysconfig/iptables, but we did not take care of ipv6. This change
is meant to take of the ipv6 part of the problem.
When including this element we empty the stock /etc/sysconfig/ip6tables
file as shipped by the iptables rpm package. The reason for this is that
puppet firewall has a hard time to cope with exiting rules when
/etc/sysconfig/iptables is populated and the iptables service is not
active. The referenced bug has a full explanation for the problem.

Note that ipv6 is slightly more delicate because we will also need a puppet-tripleo
change that implements the dhcpv6 rule that is contained by default
in /etc/sysconfig/ip6tables:
Depends-On: If22080054b2b1fa7acfd101e8c34d2707e8e7864

Change-Id: I0dee5ff045fbfe7b55d078583e16b107eec534aa
Partial-Bug: #1657108

commit_message:
Use 'create_isolated_networks' vs 'shared_physical_network'

Use 'auth.create_isolated_networks' instead of
'network.shared_physical_network'. These were being used for the same
purpose and conflicted with each other.

Remove 'network.shared_physical_network' config option and usage.

Change-Id: I9b1031fa31cac4cac29a1c39518477131f4ed8ba

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-30 22:17:29.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/ironic', 'devstack/tools/ironic/scripts/setup-network.sh', 'devstack/settings'], 'message': 'Fix broken xenial job

MTU has been changed in neutron to 1450 by default by [0]
As result ISCSI job on xenial become broken. With this patch
PUBLIC_BRIDGE_MTU is set to smallest mtu of existed interfaces decreased
by 50. MTU on IRONIC_VM_NETWORK_BRIDGE is set to PUBLIC_BRIDGE_MTU.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/commit/51a697817da849c8f9dae9651f17cd863e170fdc

Closes-Bug: #1631875
Related-Bug: #1603268
Change-Id: I044d415410a714591e9770a57cfb8509a103cf00
(cherry picked from commit e7190eac30c8a03e92262d339e6625572c7b76eb)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix broken xenial job

MTU has been changed in neutron to 1450 by default by [0]
As result ISCSI job on xenial become broken. With this patch
PUBLIC_BRIDGE_MTU is set to smallest mtu of existed interfaces decreased
by 50. MTU on IRONIC_VM_NETWORK_BRIDGE is set to PUBLIC_BRIDGE_MTU.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/commit/51a697817da849c8f9dae9651f17cd863e170fdc

Closes-Bug: #1631875
Related-Bug: #1603268
Change-Id: I044d415410a714591e9770a57cfb8509a103cf00
(cherry picked from commit e7190eac30c8a03e92262d339e6625572c7b76eb)

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary option from plugin settings

The setting of Q_USE_PROVIDERNET_FOR_PUBLIC was added to
multitenancy job in project-config commit
7d1e2127a2b055640d90808347ae5b133df83847, so no need to set it in
the plugin settings anymore.

Multitenancy devstack setup docs are updated too.

Change-Id: I165bfc8051b9cf3fc80f299c8215712089003f3a
(cherry picked from commit 63b76e8ad19bc04ffbd76a79ca6873c0a6d5ee84)

commit_message:
Fix setting custom IRONIC_VM_NETWORK_BRIDGE

Pass IRONIC_VM_NETWORK_BRIDGE to setup-network.sh script.
Update setup-network.sh script to use new bridge name.

Change-Id: I934e5604fc1850007fb55bc637fe449ac17b98d0
(cherry picked from commit 5194f4181b2d9b4caffc85d5873ecf1143f972a1)

commit_message:
Rename 'Pluggable network providers' to 'Multi-tenant networking'

Rename the title of the spec to:
    'Multi-tenant networking (formerly Pluggable network providers)'

It is commonly referred to as multi-tenant networking. Make it easer
for people to find the spec in the index.

Change-Id: If02ed42a540b9545991b8f0a8c415f88769e1016

commit_message:
Add trailing periods to exception messages

This is a follow up to commit 5766e61406780133caae1b9823ae4f47e1f1c16b

Use getattr() as it is simpler

It was desired to fix the exception messages so they all have trailing
periods.

Change-Id: I1b0c743ff4cb9be5c8e05ffaadc1be28fd326e63

Add a comment about the catch-all exception for psutil

exception. Explain reasoning for the catch-all exception.

Don't allow callers of as_dict() to inadverdently modify the underlying
data.

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-01-26 11:54:22.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/iptables_firewall.py'], 'message': 'Handle attempt to enable br_netfilter in namespace

When the process is using the IptablesFirewall driver
and is running in namespaces, there is no
/proc/sys/net/bridge in the namespace available and
enable of netfilter for bridge fails with stacktrace
in logs.
This patch handles the exception thrown during a
failed attempted to retrieve net.bridge variable names
and prints an info message in agent logs instead of
printing a stacktrace.

Change-Id: I1ff6cedbf933ac54ef4bbf1d44fc8f57f68d57fc
Closes-bug: 1658343
'}]
commit_message:
Handle attempt to enable br_netfilter in namespace

When the process is using the IptablesFirewall driver
and is running in namespaces, there is no
/proc/sys/net/bridge in the namespace available and
enable of netfilter for bridge fails with stacktrace
in logs.
This patch handles the exception thrown during a
failed attempted to retrieve net.bridge variable names
and prints an info message in agent logs instead of
printing a stacktrace.

Change-Id: I1ff6cedbf933ac54ef4bbf1d44fc8f57f68d57fc
Closes-bug: 1658343

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-26 22:49:26.000000000', 'files': ['functions.sh'], 'message': 'Increase swappiness to try to avoid OOM killer

The OOM killer is being triggered even with significant
swap space remaining.

This patch increases the swappiness value from 10 to 30.
This is still half of the 60 default so it should avoid
excessive swapping.

Change-Id: I0d81057d66dbee0dbd3650db9f34b598e1b3356b
Closes-Bug: #1656386
'}]
commit_message:
Increase swappiness to try to avoid OOM killer

The OOM killer is being triggered even with significant
swap space remaining.

This patch increases the swappiness value from 10 to 30.
This is still half of the 60 default so it should avoid
excessive swapping.

Change-Id: I0d81057d66dbee0dbd3650db9f34b598e1b3356b
Closes-Bug: #1656386

commit_message:
Add ID property to all entities

This patch adds an "id" property to secrets, orders and containers
returned from the API.  The value of the "id" property is the unique
UUID found at the end of the entity reference.

Change-Id: I65bab35807ed2cee6ed5d6aca1c99769678751be

commit_message:
Add AuditD composable service

This patch allows the management of the AuditD service and its associated
files (such as `audit.rules`)

This is achieved by means of the `puppet-auditd` puppet module.

Also places ssh banner capabilities map on top of patch

Change-Id: Ib8bb52dde88304cb58b051bced9779c97a314d0d
Depends-On: Ie31c063b674075e35e1bfa28d1fc07f3f897407b

subject: Cleanup for resource-specific options
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-26 22:30:19.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/identity/backends/resource_options.py', 'keystone/identity/backends/sql_model.py'], 'message': 'Cleanup for resource-specific options

This patch adds in the missing helper function in the sql_model for
user to get an option out of _resource_option_mapper by the ID
eliminating the need to access a "private" attribute directly outside
of the model itself (in most cases).

This also cleans up the USER_OPTIONS_REGISTRY list allowing direct
access to the option constants in keystone.identity.backends.resouce_options.

Change-Id: I385871499da191ea58acc4ddcafebbd94b10a489
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup for resource-specific options

This patch adds in the missing helper function in the sql_model for
user to get an option out of _resource_option_mapper by the ID
eliminating the need to access a "private" attribute directly outside
of the model itself (in most cases).

This also cleans up the USER_OPTIONS_REGISTRY list allowing direct
access to the option constants in keystone.identity.backends.resouce_options.

commit_message:
Switch to decorators.idempotent_id

test.idempotent_id is being kept temporary to migrate
to new lib interface. Now idempotent_id is available as Tempest stable
interface decorators and all plugins tests using the old decorator
should be switched to new interface.

In future, Once all plugins are switched to new decorator Tempest
will remove the test.idempotent_id

Change-Id: I249d55fe2ce3f3b51e21ad013f0bfb9c7834da5f
Related-Bug: 1616913

commit_message:
Update event_dispatcher when gnocchi enabled

Per the current Ceilometer docs[1] event_dispatcher can be
set to gnocchi.

When gnocchi is enabled this should ensure messages are not
accumulated endlessly in RabbitMQ.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/ceilometer/install/dbreco.html#moving-from-ceilometer-to-gnocchi

Change-Id: I760d135f4abd89cac3ae66f002a24a083addafb7
Partial-Bug: 1624789

subject: Add a default rule for dhcpv6 traffic
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-27 10:03:20.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/firewall/pre.pp'], 'message': 'Add a default rule for dhcpv6 traffic

Via bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1657108 we need
to zero out the default rules in /etc/sysconfig/ip{6}tables in
the image.
We have done this for ipv4, but when we will do it for ipv6 we
will also need to make sure we add a rule for dhcpv6 traffic
as it is shipped in the iptables rpm. (See
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1169036 for more info)

With this change we correctly get the rule present (aka the first
ACCEPT line. The second line is due to the stock ip6tables rule
I had in my testing):
[root@overcloud-controller-0 ~]# iptables -nvL |grep 546
[root@overcloud-controller-0 ~]# ip6tables -nvL |grep 546
    0     0 ACCEPT     udp      *      *       ::/0 fe80::/64 multiport dports 546 /* 004 accept ipv6 dhcpv6 ipv6 */ state NEW
    0     0 ACCEPT     udp      *      *       ::/0 fe80::/64 udp dpt:546 state NEW

Change-Id: If22080054b2b1fa7acfd101e8c34d2707e8e7864
Partial-Bug: #1657108
'}]
commit_message:
Add a default rule for dhcpv6 traffic

Via bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1657108 we need
to zero out the default rules in /etc/sysconfig/ip{6}tables in
the image.
We have done this for ipv4, but when we will do it for ipv6 we
will also need to make sure we add a rule for dhcpv6 traffic
as it is shipped in the iptables rpm. (See
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1169036 for more info)

With this change we correctly get the rule present (aka the first
ACCEPT line. The second line is due to the stock ip6tables rule
I had in my testing):
[root@overcloud-controller-0 ~]# iptables -nvL |grep 546
[root@overcloud-controller-0 ~]# ip6tables -nvL |grep 546
    0     0 ACCEPT     udp      *      *       ::/0 fe80::/64 multiport dports 546 /* 004 accept ipv6 dhcpv6 ipv6 */ state NEW
    0     0 ACCEPT     udp      *      *       ::/0 fe80::/64 udp dpt:546 state NEW

Change-Id: If22080054b2b1fa7acfd101e8c34d2707e8e7864
Partial-Bug: #1657108

commit_message:
Allow python-memcache install from authtoken class

The python-memcache package is required if using memcached. By
default the package is not installed and the define has it set to
false. This change allows managing the python-memcache package
install from the authtoken class.

Change-Id: I7de3338061bad949f26ed0d84782124c7b61eb70
(cherry picked from commit a964f9f925c2cf28536370502a7414b1bec98975)

cinder-volume log by Huawei Driver, consume a large

commit_message:
Huawei: Mask unnecessary log print

There are a lot of unnecessary log print in the
cinder-volume log by Huawei Driver, consume a large
amount of physical space.

This commit fixes that by masking unnecessary log
print.

Change-Id: Ieabdab470183fdbd0e5435832559d80c5e9c2a97
Closes-Bug: #1635143

commit_message:
Added unit test coverage to test_limits.py for api v2

Added one new test for invalid Limit creation.
Refactored a test from `assert isinstance` to `self.assertIsInstance`.

Change-Id: I06b9dd7146c6d1a438bca745bca45b66350acbf9

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-21 09:49:31.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/windows/smbfs.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/windows/test_smbfs.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/windows/test_windows_remotefs.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/windows/remotefs.py'], 'message': 'Windows SMB: use os-brick remotefs client

os-brick now contains a Windows remote fs client so we can remove
duplicated code.

The os-brick remotefs client also allows using local paths in case
of local shares, which is mandatory in case of scale-out shares.

Change-Id: I4724c87451ac6ddb04f3ca6246beb6dc0c83799e
'}]
commit_message:
Windows SMB: use os-brick remotefs client

os-brick now contains a Windows remote fs client so we can remove
duplicated code.

The os-brick remotefs client also allows using local paths in case
of local shares, which is mandatory in case of scale-out shares.

Change-Id: I4724c87451ac6ddb04f3ca6246beb6dc0c83799e

subject: arguments are not locale decoded into Unicode
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 7350, 'name': 'Jordan Pittier', 'email': 'jordan.pittier@gmail.com', 'username': 'JordanP'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 16448, 'name': 'Pablo', 'email': 'Pablo.Iranzo@gmail.com', 'username': 'iranzo'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-16 15:54:04.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/shell.py'], 'message': 'arguments are not locale decoded into Unicode

When the openstackclient in Python2 passes command line arguments to a
subcommand it fails to pass the arguments as text
(e.g. Unicode). Instead it passes the arguments as binary data encoded
using the current locales encoding.

An easy way to see this is trying to pass a username with a non-ASCII
character.

% openstack user delete ñew
No user with a name or ID of 'ñew' exists.

What occurs internally is when the user data is retrieved it's it
properly represented in a Unicode object. However the username pased
from the command line is still a str object encoded in the locales
encoding (typically UTF-8). A string comparison is attempted between
the encoded data from the command line and the Unicode text found in
the user representation. This seldom ends well, either the comparison
fails to match or a codec error is raised.

There is a hard and fast rule, all text data must be stored in Unicode
objects and the conversion from binary encoded text to Unicode must
occur as close to the I/O boundary as possible. Python3 enforces this
behavior automatically but in Python2 it is the programmers job to do
so.

In the past there have been attempts to fix problems deep inside
internal code by attempting to decode from UTF-8. There are two
problems with this approach. First, internal code has no way to
accurately know what encoding was used to encode the binary data. This
is way it needs to be decoded as close to the I/O source as possible
because that is the best place to know the actual encoding. Guessing
UTF-8 is at best a heuristic. Second, there must be a canonical
representation for data "inside" the program, you don't want dozens of
individual modules, classes, methods, etc. performing conversions,
instead they should be able to make the assumption in what format text
is represented in, the format for text data must be Unicode. This is
another reason to decode as close to the I/O as possible.

In Python3 the argv strings are decoded from the locales encoding by
the interpreter. By the time any Python3 code sees the argv strings
they will be Unicode. However in Python2 there must be explicit code
added to decode the argv strings into Unicode.

The conversion of sys.argv into Unicode only occurs when argv is not
passed to OpenStackShell.run(). If a caller of OpenStackShell.run()
supplies their own arg it is their responsiblity to assure they are
passing actual text objects. Consider this a requirement of the API.

Note: This patch does not contain a unittest to exercise the behavior
because it is difficult to construct a test that depends on command
invocation from a shell. The general structure of the unit tests is to
pass fake argv into OpenStackShell.run() as if it came from a
shell. Because the new code only operates when argv is not passed and
defaults to sys.argv it conflicts with the unittest design.

Change-Id: I779d260744728eae8455ff9dedb6e5c09c165559
Closes-Bug: 1603494
Signed-off-by: John Dennis <jdennis@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 756d2fac67b4128312e1d779648e62f1458b4ffc)
'}]
commit_message:
arguments are not locale decoded into Unicode

When the openstackclient in Python2 passes command line arguments to a
subcommand it fails to pass the arguments as text
(e.g. Unicode). Instead it passes the arguments as binary data encoded
using the current locales encoding.

An easy way to see this is trying to pass a username with a non-ASCII
character.

% openstack user delete ñew
No user with a name or ID of 'ñew' exists.

What occurs internally is when the user data is retrieved it's it
properly represented in a Unicode object. However the username pased
from the command line is still a str object encoded in the locales
encoding (typically UTF-8). A string comparison is attempted between
the encoded data from the command line and the Unicode text found in
the user representation. This seldom ends well, either the comparison
fails to match or a codec error is raised.

There is a hard and fast rule, all text data must be stored in Unicode
objects and the conversion from binary encoded text to Unicode must
occur as close to the I/O boundary as possible. Python3 enforces this
behavior automatically but in Python2 it is the programmers job to do
so.

In the past there have been attempts to fix problems deep inside
internal code by attempting to decode from UTF-8. There are two
problems with this approach. First, internal code has no way to
accurately know what encoding was used to encode the binary data. This
is way it needs to be decoded as close to the I/O source as possible
because that is the best place to know the actual encoding. Guessing
UTF-8 is at best a heuristic. Second, there must be a canonical
representation for data "inside" the program, you don't want dozens of
individual modules, classes, methods, etc. performing conversions,
instead they should be able to make the assumption in what format text
is represented in, the format for text data must be Unicode. This is
another reason to decode as close to the I/O as possible.

In Python3 the argv strings are decoded from the locales encoding by
the interpreter. By the time any Python3 code sees the argv strings
they will be Unicode. However in Python2 there must be explicit code
added to decode the argv strings into Unicode.

The conversion of sys.argv into Unicode only occurs when argv is not
passed to OpenStackShell.run(). If a caller of OpenStackShell.run()
supplies their own arg it is their responsiblity to assure they are
passing actual text objects. Consider this a requirement of the API.

Note: This patch does not contain a unittest to exercise the behavior
because it is difficult to construct a test that depends on command
invocation from a shell. The general structure of the unit tests is to
pass fake argv into OpenStackShell.run() as if it came from a
shell. Because the new code only operates when argv is not passed and
defaults to sys.argv it conflicts with the unittest design.

Change-Id: I779d260744728eae8455ff9dedb6e5c09c165559
Closes-Bug: 1603494
Signed-off-by: John Dennis <jdennis@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 756d2fac67b4128312e1d779648e62f1458b4ffc)

subject: LeftHand Fix terminate_connection when failed over
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-24 05:06:52.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/hpe/hpe_lefthand_iscsi.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_hpelefthand.py'], 'message': 'LeftHand Fix terminate_connection when failed over

Terminate connection will fail when a detach is called on a failed
over volume. This patch allows terminate_connection to succeed in
order to allow reattachments to secondary arrays.

Change-Id: I9057f1c5d6e5716a6283c3b08ddad7bfe4904234
Closes-Bug: #1580693
(cherry picked from commit 6ab5e5234b5435f7bcfe33b3963568e2605d2d82)
'}]
commit_message:
LeftHand Fix terminate_connection when failed over

Terminate connection will fail when a detach is called on a failed
over volume. This patch allows terminate_connection to succeed in
order to allow reattachments to secondary arrays.

Change-Id: I9057f1c5d6e5716a6283c3b08ddad7bfe4904234
Closes-Bug: #1580693
(cherry picked from commit 6ab5e5234b5435f7bcfe33b3963568e2605d2d82)

commit_message:
Add qpid-dispatch-router to overcloud-controller element

This is groundwork preparing the Qpid dispatch router as an
alternative AMQP messaging backend to RabbitMQ/etc.

Also adds cyrus-sasl-plain and qpid-dispatch-tools, which are soft
dependencies installed by the puppet-qdr module.

Change-Id: If1750860cc0cbc10467126384a1f803e63324c9a

subject: Pass parameters for TLS proxy in front of neutron server
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-27 15:31:30.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/neutron-api.yaml'], 'message': "Pass parameters for TLS proxy in front of neutron server

If TLS in the internal network is enabled, we run neutron-server
behind a TLS proxy (which is actually httpd's mod_proxy). This passes
the necessary hieradata.

bp tls-via-certmonger
Depends-On: I6dfbf49f45aef9f47e58b5c0dbedd2b4e239979e

Change-Id: I9252512dbf9cf2e3eec50c41bf10629d36070bbd
"}]
commit_message:
Pass parameters for TLS proxy in front of neutron server

If TLS in the internal network is enabled, we run neutron-server
behind a TLS proxy (which is actually httpd's mod_proxy). This passes
the necessary hieradata.

bp tls-via-certmonger
Depends-On: I6dfbf49f45aef9f47e58b5c0dbedd2b4e239979e

Change-Id: I9252512dbf9cf2e3eec50c41bf10629d36070bbd

subject: Add timeout for storlet daemon shutdown
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-27 19:17:35.000000000', 'files': ['storlets/agent/daemon/server.py', 'storlets/agent/daemon_factory/server.py', 'storlets/gateway/gateways/docker/runtime.py', 'storlets/agent/common/server.py'], 'message': 'Add timeout for storlet daemon shutdown

Previously, storlet daemon never stops until all its subprocesses
exit, but it can cause forever running processes, if the storlet
application running in the process get stucked.

This patch sets timeout when we shutdown storlet daemon.

NOTE:
Currently timeout value is hard coded, but it should be configurable
after we add some mechanism to pass configuration parameters to the
processes inside docker container.

Change-Id: I885f15396488f06b1b2a6d4c1f987e4b4a525bff
'}]
commit_message:
Add timeout for storlet daemon shutdown

Previously, storlet daemon never stops until all its subprocesses
exit, but it can cause forever running processes, if the storlet
application running in the process get stucked.

This patch sets timeout when we shutdown storlet daemon.

NOTE:
Currently timeout value is hard coded, but it should be configurable
after we add some mechanism to pass configuration parameters to the
processes inside docker container.

Change-Id: I885f15396488f06b1b2a6d4c1f987e4b4a525bff

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems
to achieve iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will
return iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more
readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible,
see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I5b3c435f272dbfb3a47fe00f99bb7836f6139152
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems with dict.items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems
to achieve iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will
return iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more
readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible,
see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I5b3c435f272dbfb3a47fe00f99bb7836f6139152

commit_message:
Improve exception handling in daemon factory

* Remove unnecessory catch-and-reraise
* Use more specific exception type and exception scope
* Make main process more safe for unknown exception case

subject: Add allow_abbrev=True test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-11 18:47:05.000000000', 'files': ['cliff/tests/test_app.py'], 'message': "Add allow_abbrev=True test

This is a follow-on to Ib38617ad08d930df1dcf263f4812b746b858a245
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/278781/) that reverted the changing of
the default value of argparse's allow_abbrev attribute.

* Test setting argparse's allow_abbrev=False in App.build_option_parser().
* Test default config where first option gets the value.

To set allow_abbrev=False, add the following to the application's
App subclass:

    def build_option_parser(self, description, version):
        parser = super(MyApp, self).build_option_parser(
            description,
            version,
            argparse_kwargs={'allow_abbrev': False},
        )

Change-Id: I45238512a06464edf99c90d525c79f1a76951379
"}]
commit_message:
Add allow_abbrev=True test

This is a follow-on to Ib38617ad08d930df1dcf263f4812b746b858a245
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/278781/) that reverted the changing of
the default value of argparse's allow_abbrev attribute.

* Test setting argparse's allow_abbrev=False in App.build_option_parser().
* Test default config where first option gets the value.

To set allow_abbrev=False, add the following to the application's
App subclass:

    def build_option_parser(self, description, version):
        parser = super(MyApp, self).build_option_parser(
            description,
            version,
            argparse_kwargs={'allow_abbrev': False},
        )

Change-Id: I45238512a06464edf99c90d525c79f1a76951379

commit_message:
Alter SQL injection plugin to consider .format strings

This considers `"{}".format()` style alongside `"%s" % ` string
formatting for possible SQL injection vulnerabilities.

commit_message:
cap python-novaclient/oslo.vmware/gabbi

novaclient 7.0.0 and oslo.vmware 2.17.0 have removed some backward
compat thing.

(like interface renamed endpoint_type)

So we cap them.

Also cap WebOb < 1.7.0 to allow gabbi to succeed.

Closes-bug: #1659098
Change-Id: I6cc9dbfa0f25736cf8f01af24255a6f45ae2dd9b

commit_message:
Add reference to puppet-auditd

Needed to manage auditd so that operators can populate auditd parameters,
and adhere to security compliance regulations.

A decision to use puppet-auditd was made on the module being actively developed,
having the highest user score.

Partial-Bug: #1640302

Change-Id: I5b3805333f2b97de7bde261b2f28c15884a7c2dd

commit_message:
Test hostname map

Deploy with a hostname map and verify that the instance names end
up as specified.

Change-Id: I3a120e784c8862b112869288ccf87ee1634b3564
